Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the final work on the science of medicine, due to its comprehensiveness and its explanations, and because of its clarity, it seems fitting to me that I present to you this treatise, which is a part of practical knowledge or skill by hand, namely surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because practical skill by hand is almost entirely neglected in our region and at this time, to the point that it endangers the science itself, and its vestiges are obscured; there remains of it only a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which modern scholars have distorted, leading them into error and hesitation, while their minds remain closed and their abilities weakened.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	It is clear to me that I must revive this skill through the organization of this treatise according to a method of exposition and explanation, as well as by abbreviation; and so that it may be accompanied by illustrations of cautery instruments and other tools necessary for the work, both through additional explanations and through preparation, which are essential.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why there are no good practitioners of this skill in our time is that the art of medicine is extensive and demands that its practitioner first be well-versed in the science of anatomy, which includes knowledge of the joints and their forms, as well as their connections and separations; an understanding of bones, nerves, and sinews, including their numbers and origins; and an awareness of pulsating veins, quiet ones, and where they emerge.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And regarding this, Hippocrates says that it has a great name but little effect in practice, and especially so in the skill of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already mentioned this in the introduction of this book; for one who is not knowledgeable about what we have discussed regarding anatomy, it is unlikely that they will avoid falling into error which has caused the deaths of many men, as I myself have witnessed numerous such instances, where some are educated in this science but lack knowledge and experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	I witnessed a foolish and inexperienced physician accidentally incision an abscess on the neck of a woman, severing some arteries in the process which led to a great flow of blood until the woman bled out and died while her maid held her.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	I saw another physician who was about to perform an operation on a man with kidney stones and the stone was large; however, he was stopped and shown mercy by extracting that stone along with a piece of his bladder, which caused the man's death three days later.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	I have already been called upon to extract such a stone and observed that due to the size of the kidney stone and the condition of the patient, I knew he would not survive.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	Certainly! Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called upon them, and prepared to release the ligature, and thus achieved calmness and relief from their pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, if the corruption had already set in within a limb to an extent that it cannot be stopped, and this corruption continues to spread throughout the member until the patient's health is at risk.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	I saw another physician who had punctured a cancerous abscess, and it became ulcerated after several days due to the severity of his condition.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which is why the cause of this ailment comes from the excess of melancholy humours in the body, and it should not be treated with iron or steel but rather by using methods that can be applied directly to the affected member.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my children, it is essential that you understand the operation in two parts: one part is associated with bringing about good health while the other has more perilous implications and must be carried out carefully.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	I have already explained this thoroughly throughout this book where I describe the operation as being an error-prone and fearful process; you must ensure that you safeguard yourself against it and steer clear of it so that these pages do not become a cause for slander or embarrassment to yourselves.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And so, take up your weapons with solicitude and under God's protection; treat your patients with ease and fortitude.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	Use the best method for healing through God's grace, leading to salvation and laudable recovery; leave behind those terrible diseases that are difficult to cure, and keep your weapons away from what makes you fearful, so that doubt does not diminish your faith and reputation: for greater glory remains with you in this world and beyond among your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Wisdom has already spoken through some of its hints:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat an illness poorly, lest you be called bad doctors.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins with the first chapter, which is divided into two parts:
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is organized around the foot, detailing the necessary instruments and tools such as cauteries for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The second division of the book.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter deals with dryness and perforation, cupping, sores, extraction of arrows, and similar things; all this is set out and arranged in the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division into three parts.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter is about restoration and dislocation, as well as the treatment of sprains and similar injuries. This chapter is organized around the head and feet, and describes the forms of instruments used.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On cauterization with fire and acute medicine, as well as recollection of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With this begins the treatise on all the book's contents.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I will explain the quality of the iron of that cautery tool and the materials it is made from, as well as in which situations cauterization is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Thus I say that the discourse on the quality of cautery iron and its material is long and prolix, subtle in science, and hidden in secrecy; great multitude of wise men have already spoken about it, and they are disagreed, so a little of their discourses suffices me, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	Here is my best translation attempt: 
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the opposite, claiming that cauterization is beneficial for all diseases caused by cold and dry humors that invade men's bodies, for when you compare man's body with his wetness to fire's composition, you find man's body to be cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say, based on the words of that man, who has experienced this many times before to discover it.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not appropriate for someone to come forward on this matter who has already been tested and practiced in the chapter of cauterization through previous experience, and understands the variety of human composition and the disposition of diseases within their bodies, as well as their causes, incidents, and duration.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But for other compositions, there should be no fear on your part, especially in the case of cold and wet diseases, as all doctors have already agreed upon these, and they do not disagree about the benefit of using cauterization to treat them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my children, that the secret of cure through cauterization with fire and its goodness are based on caustic medicine using cautery, for fire is simple in action and does not affect any other member but the one being cauterized, causing little harm to adjacent parts.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	Furthermore, the action of burning medicine applied to those parts of the body that are distant from the affected area can lead to diseases in these members that have a difficult cure and easily recur.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, due to its excellence and the goodness of its substance, does nothing but overflow superfluously. And it is known to us through experiment and long years of study in the art that this is true for the causes; and thus I am excused from a lengthy sermon. If it were not because my book has not been read by you in this secluded place where we are together, hidden secretly within yourselves with fire, and the quality of its operation in bodies and its expulsion through which illnesses are expelled, with philosophical discourse demonstrated, which would sharpen your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And you should know, my children, that they disagree about the time which is most suitable for performing a cautery, and consider spring to be the best time.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I say that a cautery is suitable at any time, because the harm caused by the weather can be offset by the benefit gained from what is drawn out through the cautery. Furthermore, if it is for pain or necessary wounds (even severe and festering), these do not tolerate delay, as it is feared that greater harm may come to them due to a minor injury developing over time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Moreover, superfluous cauterization is employed in medical practice due to the haste of the practitioner, the effectiveness of its therapeutic virtues, and the importance attributed to it by their lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible for the illness to recur at some point in time depending on the constitution of the patient, the location and nature of their ailment, as well as their inherent strength, the level of congestion within their body, the types of food consumed, or factors akin to these causes; however, illnesses treated with cauterization are subtle ailments involving members afflicted by minimal excesses and moisture. For instance, dental cauterization for pain or similar treatments rarely lead to recurring discomfort, but only when performed on a small scale.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	Common parlance often portrays cauterization as medicine's last resort, a sentiment shared by legal experts who perceive it not as an avenue for cure or benefit from medical intervention but solely as a means to an end through cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The reasoning behind this is contrary to popular belief; the notion that cauterization serves as medicine's final option arises when we observe certain ailments where standard treatment methods fail to provide relief and only then do we resort to cautery, which proves beneficial.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And then from here on you should understand that the cautery is the last resort of medicine, not according to the intention as I understand it by the common people and too many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	The ancients said that a golden cautery is better than one made of iron, and they said this only because of the equality of gold and the excellence of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cautery is not arm-like (weak), but this is not absolutely true, for I have proven it and found that it does so only in some bodies without others; thus a golden cauterization is good and better than iron, as they say. But when you do cauterization with fire using gold, it's not clear to you because it is hidden according to the amount you want due to the softness of gold, and because heat prepares to receive cold. And if you place it over a flame, the gold melts from the fire; perhaps in the fire are some sheets so that the artisan catches [it] by handling [them].
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this reason, iron cautery is done more lightly and more properly to the rectification of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	I have already ordered this chapter on cauterization according to the chapters, and I have arranged those of the head within the feet, so that later the enquirer may find what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization procedure introduces a cold and wet accident in the brain, which is caused by two factors: one being the cause of many traumatic issues such as nosebleeds from head injuries, fluid discharge from the ears, excessive sleepiness, toothaches, and throat pain; the other affecting universal ailments like frigidity, palsy, stroke, and conditions resembling these.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The procedure for this cauterization is as follows: First, instruct the patient to take laxative medicine to empty their bowels for three to four nights, depending on the condition of their health and their age.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then, instruct the patient to shave their head and sit on a chair with their arms raised and hands resting on their legs.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then, place the edge of your palm on their nose, between their eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, once your middle finger has reached that spot, mark the area with ink and prepare the olive-shaped cautery like this:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	Then place that on the marked spot and pull it down gently so that your hand gradually compresses the skin, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then lift your hand gently and check the spot; if you see that any part of the bone is already exposed or as much as a grain of barley, raise your hand, but return it to the same iron or another one cooled according to what I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	Then take some salt, dissolve it over the wound, and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place the frostbitten limb in cold water, and leave it there until the burnt skin is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the wound with four-ingredient ointment until it heals.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And I say that when Roman pitch is opened, the arm gets better because it is more effective and beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	Some say that the bone should be cauterized when it is broken and that the cautery should be held until a part of the surface of the bone adheres.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove what is sticking out of the bone, and treat it accordingly.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	Other doctors say that the cautery should be applied to the back part of the body, pressing strongly on the bone until it makes an impression. This is the technique known as small alheph.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They believe that vapors from the head emanate from this area.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	If the wound remains open for too long, then treat it so that it becomes consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen these two types of cautery applied in practice, only in some cases due to fear; leave that aside, I believe it is better for health when the head, like other parts of the body, can be treated and cured with continuity, especially if the patient's head is of a weak nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first type of cautery is safer and better in my opinion; I use that method for the benefit of the patient's health.
Capitol segon.	It seems like the text you provided is part of a larger work, as "Capitol Segon" might indicate a chapter or section heading. I can continue translating if you provide me with more text from the same source.
Del cauteri del cap.	Del cauteri del cap.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When a patient experiences chronic and prolonged pain in their entire head, and they have tried various treatments such as bloodletting, leeches, clysters (enemas), poultices, cataplasms, baths, foments, compresses, and similar remedies without any improvement, especially if they have already been cauterized with a large iron but it did not benefit them for any of those reasons, consider whether the patient's head is of strong constitution in its nature; and it has very thick humors, then use another type of cautery, slightly smaller than the previous one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize that spot on the top of their head with a hot iron while the sinews are divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the sinews and expose the bone to the extent we have described, then cauterize it with an iron on the back of the head in the place called 'vas', which is where a cupping glass is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	Always keep your hand there and do not uncover the bone, for the patient will experience great pain different from that of all other cauterizations on the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will call this cautery by its place, for know that the iron with which you cauterize the horns of the head and the occiput is a more delicate iron than the one used to cauterize the top of the head; and this is its shape.
Capitol ters.	Chapter Three." 
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is a headache or pain that spreads from the head to the eyes, first evacuate and clean the head with appropriate medicine, and then administer other treatments as I have mentioned in my previous writings on illnesses; if all these do not bring improvement, cauterization of the patient should be performed in two ways: either by using caustic medicines that burn or by applying an iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	Using a caustic medicine means you take a piece of garlic, peel it, and cut off its ends on both sides.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then make an incision on the painful area of the temple using a lancet, making sure it is done at the same spot underneath where the vein was previously located and hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Apply pressure on the patient using a tight bandage for half an hour; then remove it and take out the garlic, leaving the plaster in place for two or three days. After that, place a poultice soaked in wine on the affected area until the skin turns red.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Finally, treat it with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	If you wish, perform this procedure using some caustic medicines, which I have described in the second book about such remedies.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Furthermore, cauterization with an iron should be done in this manner: ignite the following type of cautery:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called 'claus clavilhs', as its head has the shape of a nail with some curvature, and it has a small prominence in its middle.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then place it on the painful spot, hold your hand still - so that the arch below is not stuck - and rotate the iron slowly with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of it that sticks to the skin due to the heat is such that half of it [the iron] does, lift your hand so that the artery below is not stuck, in order to avoid a flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then soak lint in salty water and place it on the area for three days; then apply wet cotton with a bandage, and finally heal [it] with ointment until cured.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you cauterize with the tip of a knife like a cautery, be careful not to cut any artery in this rather new method.
Capitol quart.	Capitol quart is likely an archaic term indicating that this is chapter four of the treatise.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Chapter four: on the cauterization of old hemorrhoids.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat hemorrhoids using the methods described previously and as outlined in the section on diseases, if the treatment is not effective or the illness does not respond to what we have said about the first cautery with medicine or the cautery with fire, it is necessary that you ignite a knife-like cautery until it is white hot. This means applying it to the painful area along the length of half your finger's width (or another measurement) and then placing your hand on top once for strength; press down hard enough so as not to reach bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is essential that you take care not to damage the jaw joint, which is necessary for chewing and may be injured; additionally ensure the tendon is not stuck or the nerve controlling it damaged, so as to prevent spasms from occurring.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about safeguarding and preventing the bleeding of an arterial wound which has been cut, as there is fear at the beginning of this operation for those who do not know what they are doing or have no understanding of it and leave the operation to them; then place your hand on top once for strength.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will return to discussing the treatment for accidental blood flow from archery wounds in its designated place within this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you encounter this illness and find that the aforementioned cautery treatment is not suitable due to an intolerable state of the patient's body, apply a cauterization in the middle of their head as previously described, and treat any resulting wounds until they are healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And when administering the cautery treatment mentioned earlier in the chapter on archery wounds using two small cauteries, this method of cauterization is preferable and more effective.

De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cauterization of ear pain." 
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is ear pain caused by coldness and it is treated with laxatives and other remedies mentioned in the previous section, but the pain persists and does not improve, then apply the cautery treatment. This type of cauterization is called "puncturing," and its shape is as follows: [Describe the shape or provide an illustration here]
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then proceed to puncture the flame [or ignite it] and move it around the entire ear as if you are drawing a circle, or in the vicinity of each affected area if the pain is localized.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Along with the application of the cautery, you should also use a small amount of tar at the base of the ear after you have marked the area to be treated.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if you apply the pointed cautery all over the ear until it blisters, then treat those areas [afterward] so that they may heal properly.

De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the Cauterization of Torture. 
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Turtura, which is cured and treated with cauterization, involves specific herbs that are effective due to their phlegm-reducing properties, as we mentioned in the classification of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization with herbs that cause drying or nerve spasms.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When treating this type of turtura with syringes, clysters, and gargles, and your treatment is not successful, it is necessary to cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first should be applied to the root of their ear, the second just below their temple, and the third at the junction of their lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	Place your cautery on the area opposite to the affected part, as softening will only occur in the seemingly healthy region.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cauterization is as follows: apply the cautery to the right side of the topmost part of the ear, slightly above the crown of the head, and another one just below the temple; the length of this second cautery should be equivalent to the length of your little finger. As you hold the cautery in place with one hand, ensure that it burns an area half the size of a coin.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	Here is my translation of your provided text: 
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is more subtle when there is a little less of this, and it is necessary for him to remove some of the excessive fat.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with something in front, which should be processed before it is healed.

Capitol .viii.	Chapter 5.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Regarding the oblivion caused by cauterization with a flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Give the patient large jars and pills of well-mixed medicine at the beginning.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then shave the patient's head entirely, and apply on their skull a plaster made of centaury as described in the chapter dedicated to plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And leave it for some time; this is how one uses the cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	Do all of that in the order described before.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col. E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place between each cauterization a finger's width apart, and then treat the cautery with something that has been proven effective.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If the patient is tolerant and the affliction is minor, then cauterize them in the middle area; if it is more severe, cauterize them over both hips.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat it until it is healed, and let the cautery be olive-shaped as previously described.

De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Regarding the cauterization of parasites and the softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Undergo the procedure on the patient's head with scalpels and according to what we have described; then shave their head, and proceed to cauterize them with a pointed cautery in the middle of the head, with cautery over all the horns of the head, with cautery over the back part of it, and with three cauteries on the neck vertebrae.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the case of softening of the chest due to excessive flatulence and the patient's condition being severe, then cauterize them with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and finally apply cautery along their spine, making sure not to burn their skin.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then treat the patient as they recover, and ensure this is done with olive oil-based cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	An epileptic person is not to be cauterized unless their epilepsy is caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	You must operate on the patient's brain at the beginning with scalpels, and then apply all other treatment described in the division when the patient is large and tolerant of medications, except for medicines that are to be avoided.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if the child does not tolerate medications well, then administer gargles and chewable lozenges made from a softened brain; do this for many days with proper consideration of their diet.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the head of the patient and cauterize it with a cautery at the top of their head, following the previous procedure; use another cautery on their occipital region (back of the head), and perform cauterization over each corner or side of the head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and can tolerate it, then cauterize them with the aforementioned cauteries while keeping their body paralyzed and immobilized on the neck vertebrae and back vertebrae.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And use an olive oil-based cautery, as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	However, if the patient is a child, then use a more delicate cautery in this manner.

De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cauterization of melancholia." 
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholia are corrupt humors and a weak body constitution, then cauterize that area with the cauteries we mentioned for treating paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholia is an excess that leads to it, and the patient's body is moist or damp, then give them a drink that purifies their brain according to the type described in the previous section.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then scrape the patient's head, and then make a decent dove-tail joint of them over the circle, and finally place that in the middle of their head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And if the patient is sixty days old and has been seized by an attack from all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then place the ointment or liniment on it, and the older the sheep's tallow is, the better.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat it over the fire to warm it up moderately, which they say is what caused their suffering when it was put on them.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then take it to the middle of their head in the circle, and leave it there until it cools down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this to the patient once every week until they are healed; or if you want, cauterize them with small points according to their age and condition - but be sure to keep your hand on a cautery like this: it is a type of moistening cautery that equalizes the brain.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that inflamed elbow in bran or goose grease.

De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On cauterizing water-related illnesses in children.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have identified the onset of a water-related illness in a child through the signs I mentioned earlier, start by giving them something to drink that will alter their head and avoid all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make sure they soak in warm baths twice a day for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command them to shave their head and cauterize it with a single-pointed cautery in the middle of the scalp; then cauterize with two pointed cauteries over both temples if there is water discharge from both ears, or on one side if there is water discharge from only one ear.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cauterize all the veins and arteries that are beneath this line, with the cauteries placed at a distance equal to the width of your thumb from the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	Be careful of blood flow when cauterizing; if you see blood flowing from the site, stop and apply some medicine to it if you can.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with wisdom that is in extraction of arrows and in the excision of those, and caution against blood flow.

De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses. Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of nasal odor.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar. E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	As for the pointed cautery, this is its shape.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Regarding the cautery for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened due to illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with this lunar-shaped cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you were to cauterize this area above the eyebrows with two small, separate cauteries that extend up from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the amount/length of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press the cautery too hard with your hand, but rather according to how much the upper eyelid is stuck together.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Regarding the cautery for the eyelid of the eye when the hairs become sparse within it and around its socket.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the wound is turned into scabs inside so that it becomes sore to the touch, cauterization on those areas can be done in two ways: either with fire or with caustic medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you use cauterization with fire, ask the patient to shave their hair like those who clean themselves, even if it takes a long time and is unpleasant; and when you've done that, you must cover his wounds with a bandage so they don't get worse while the hairs grow back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Once the hairs have grown back and are shaved again, place the patient's head on your lap, then make a sign over their eyes with ash in the shape of a myrtle leaf, starting the sign near the hair.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then place a poultice of pigeon dung or ground flax seed on the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then ignite this particular type of cautery.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Then cauterize the area you've marked in small dots, gradually burning away the surface of the skin so that it resembles a myrtle leaf in appearance.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of the good condition of the skin's work is that you see the eyelid of the hole already being contracted and his hairs be raised above the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	So raise your hand and leave it like that for three days, and then place a pillow under them until the sore is raised.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then cure her with ointment so that it gets healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if for some reason the hairs grow back and the eyelid gets softened, then do another cauterization like you did in the first place.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs remain on the eyelid, then cauterize it to lift them up to their original place and align them so they don't hurt the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But if the cauterization with caustic medicine is that you command the patient to pull out the hairs until they are long and aligned, then a cloth-made leaf of myrtle should be prepared.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	Then take one ounce of known wax and fresh cow's fat, mix those causes well, and make this a thick paste so it doesn't cool down; then spread this over the cloth that is made in the shape of a myrtle leaf, and place this on one or both eyes; then put under the eye a linen cloth soaked in egg white, and have their head resting on your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Place your finger on the medicine and press it lightly, but be careful not to irritate the wound until the patient feels a burning sensation from the medicine, for this burning is like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	So when you perceive that the patient has felt enough of this burning sensation, then remove your finger from the medicine and use your little finger to gently wipe it away; once the burning subsides, remove the medicine and clean the wound with water. Then, examine whether the eyelid is already elevated like a swollen eyelid should be. If not, you must proceed either by applying heat or making an incision, for then it will be well. And if not, repeat the application of the medicine to the same spot where there was no pressure from your finger and do so without harming the wound, lest your operation is ruined and the eye damaged.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then place a compress on it with a cloth so that the discharge of pus is removed from the wound, and then treat it with ointment or another healing substance until it heals.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is necessary for you to ensure in your operation that no medicine falls into the eye and should the eyelid after a few days become softened by some cause of hair touching it, then repeat your medicine on this spot where the eyelid has softened, doing so just as you did at first, until healing occurs.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra." 
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the bodies of men are diversified according to their size and smallness, and therefore your treatment must be adjusted accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And let the path of healing not be hidden from him who is studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	This appears to be a chapter or section heading, but without further context, I cannot determine its exact meaning. Is there additional text or information that you would like me to translate or interpret?
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula that is located in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula using the methods described in the previous sections without success, it is necessary to cauterize it as follows: instruct the patient to place their head on your lap and have an assistant hold their head gently between their hands, ensuring they are comfortable and not agitated.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then place a ball of wool or cotton pad soaked in oil on the patient's eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then apply this type of cautery, which is shaped as follows:" (Here, the text likely describes the shape or form of the cautery tool.)
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	It should be concave in shape, resembling the quill of a reed or an eagle's feather, with the cautery at one end.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you (are), then penetrate into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish, come out like that as well (as it tries to escape).
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the one who is concave is better for this operation.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then press on the open fistula and try to cleanse it; dry that (wound) well.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it (the fistula) yourself and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place on it the cautery that is well ignited; hold your hand over the patient's nose with the cautery slightly away from his nostrils so as not to burn your own hand or disturb the patient, then place the cautery against the nostril and cauterize it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if at the beginning of your cauterization you perceive bone, it is good (to continue); but if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice if necessary; leave it like this for three days and place a compress over it; cover it with drying ointment until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If eleven days have passed and there is still no healing, then apply an acute corrosive medicine on him until the bone is exposed and scraped according to what is mentioned in your chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	Another method of cauterizing a fistula, as some ancient physicians said: go to the location of the fistula and open it; then place in that opening a soft ball whose form is like this: Make one ounce of molten lead inside it; hold your hand carefully so that the patient is not harmed by the molten lead reaching his wound; cover the patient's wound with linen cloth dipped in egg white or water, because lead hardens the location of the fistula and heals it miraculously.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	If the fistula is healed by what we have said about cauterization and treatment, it is good. But if not, then it is necessary to administer a nasal tube and reduce the fistula into the nose as will follow in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of anal fissures.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Wounds that occur in the form of fissures on the lips happen very often, especially in children's lips.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fractures with what we have discussed in the previous sections and your treatment is not effective, then use a small pointed cautery like this one as shown below:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let the cavity of the patient be according to the sharpness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that heated end of the cautery carefully into those fractures until it reaches their depth.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Regarding the cauterization of fistulas in the mouth." 
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat. De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of teeth and softening of veins.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by humidity and the teeth are inflamed, treating them with medicines will not help. Place the patient's head in your lap, then take a cautery of the shape that I will describe now, place the tube over the tooth, and insert the burning cauterization tool quickly; hold it there until the patient feels heat from the fire at the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then lift your hand, and repeat the cauterization several times as you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient rinse their mouth with salt water and hold it there for an hour; after that, dry out the mouth because the inflamed tooth is cooled down, the softened gum is tightened up, and the corrupting humidity has been dried.

De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is caused by coldness or when there is a chill or worm in the tooth, and you cannot treat it with medicine, then cauterization of that area can be done in two ways: either with cow dung or with fire (heat).
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	For cauterization with cow dung, you take fresh cow dung and wrap it around the end of an iron rod (or similar implement), then dip this wrapped end in hot cow dung, and place it quickly on the painful tooth until it becomes cold.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	Repeat this process several times until the healing property of the heat reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you prefer to dip wool or cotton in the cow dung and place it on the sore tooth, then put an ignited iron rod on top of this until the iron reaches the hollow cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, be cautious with cauterization by fire; pay attention to the size of the cautery (quannula), whether it is made of copper or iron, and ensure that there are no large objects or sharp points inside the patient's mouth which could cause harm.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then heat the cautery to the appropriate shape, place it on the tooth and hold your hand over it until the cautery becomes cold; do this several times per day for as long as the pain persists or is aggravated.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And when the patient feels pressure from the cautery, they should fill their mouth with good wine and hold it there for an hour before spitting it out; this is the proper way to apply the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	Cauterize any extremity that you see fit based on your judgment.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is the shape of the cannula:" (proceeds to describe the physical appearance or design of the medical device)

De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of extrophies (or external growths)." 
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.
