E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this type of treatment is safer than incision and less terrifying.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Some soft swellings are cured with something more subtle than cauterization and incision, for they are treated by subfumigation in this manner: take cumin, hyssop, rue, wormwood, Arabic stichwort, chamomile, bruised borage and other similar herbs, and mix all these causes, or some of them, into a bowl, and let them be submerged in vinegar, and boil; the bowl should be well sealed with proper wax, and there must be an opening in the middle of the bowl over which is placed an instrument thus constructed: made of silver or copper.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And insert the extremity into the mouth of the patient until the vapour reaches the uvula upon which it is directed, until the uvula becomes greatly obscured.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	Then repeat this on those many swellings until they are dry, and take care not to perform this cure at the beginning of an abscess's development, as it would aggravate the abscess, and you must instead declare that the abscess should be lanced.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	However, if you do not have this instrument at hand, then take a cane and fit on its extremity a cock's spur, so that the mouth of the patient may be closed, for the spur of the cock prevents the vapour from escaping through the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this cure is beneficial for recovery.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38. (Or 'Chapter Thirty-Eight', depending on the preferred translation.)
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of thorns, lodged objects in the throat, and other similar cases.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Small foreign bodies stuck in the throat, such as fish bones or other sharp objects.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Therefore, you must extract whatever is visible and within reach; press the patient's tongue with an instrument in front of light source to expose what is stuck in their throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And for objects that are not apparent and hidden in the throat, you must make the patient vomit before food is digested in their stomach; often, the cause lodged in the throat will be expelled through vomiting. You can also have the patient swallow a piece of bread soaked in milk or dry bread; or take a piece of dry marine sponge, bind it strongly with bile, and then let the patient swallow this, as when it reaches the place where fish bones are usually extracted, they too shall be expelled.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquellas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma: 
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And if it is a bit thicker than rope, and its extremity has a concavity that you can insert into his mouth easily.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	Raise his head upwards and be careful not to touch his neck bone because it might cause an injury to the spine or vertebrae.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But when the patient moves it deeper inside, due to his understanding of the location of the cause and pushing downwards, pull your hand with the instrument along with it based on how much is ready to be extracted.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the extraction of leeches attached to the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the leech is treated with what we have said in the division of treatment with medicines and it does not work, look at the patient's throat under the sun, as you have already compressed their tongue with an instrument that has been described to you.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore, if you see the leech, extract it with little force or subtle gestures decently.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, and he will fall asleep.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	Another method of operation is through fumigation with this instrument: take a bowl containing burning coals and cover it with a cloth that has an opening in the middle, where the end of the instrument should be placed. Then perform the fumigation; have the patient place their mouth on the end of the tube and close their mouth to ensure the fumigation reaches the bloodstream, for once the blood is affected, the patient will fall asleep.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	If this does not work, then repeat the fumigation several times, and have the patient refrain from drinking; they should eat salty foods and almonds, but drink no water, and it is necessary that this regimen be followed.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	This is the shape of the instrument used to extract blood from the gullet when it is visible; it is similar to a pair of forceps but with some curvature in its design.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	The instrument is placed in the gullet and its tip resembles the beak of a stork, which is serrated like a file; this ensures that when it grasps any object, it does not slip away.
Capitol .xl.	Here is my translation of your text: 
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the discourse regarding carbuncles and their incision.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Carbuncles are special marks, of various shapes, depending on their appearance, as described in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	They vary in their treatment and incision through two methods: one is specific to the type of carbuncle itself; another takes into account its moistness.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	The second method considers the locations on the body where carbuncles occur, as a carbuncle on the head differs from one on the buttocks, and a carbuncle in a fleshy area is different from one found at a joint; each requires its own judgment for treatment.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	Some carbuncles should not be incised, but rather allowed to mature and heal on their own or with the aid of remedies.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Other carbuncles should be treated by puncturing when they are hard and have not yet matured according to their size, especially those that are near joints; for if a carbuncle is next to a joint, the movement of it may prolong its existence until eventually, the ligaments or nerves of said joint become corrupted causing contraction in that limb. Or if it is located on a major limb, and you delay incision while it matures, the limb itself will be harmed; so too if it is close to the anus - then do not hesitate to treat one which has not matured yet, provided it does not penetrate deeper into the body's interior or lengthen towards the inner parts of the anus, thus becoming a fistula. Also, beware not treating one that was punctured but has not fully digested and so is not completed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	Mays cover that you know the time for draining the abscess, and this is when it has ripened.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And know that it has ripened when there is a reduction in pain and the fever breaks, along with a decrease in swelling and pulse rate, and an increase in the sharpness of the abscess's head, as well as other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And make sure you know to pierce the area just beneath the abscess and move outwards from there for a successful cure of the swelling.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	Piercing can always be done through the length of flesh or body, whether abscesses are located on limbs or feet, and in places like joints, tendons, ligaments, and more; lastly, it is suitable for all areas that do not reflect heat; as for those that do, use piercing techniques suited to that specific limb.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is located in a fleshy area, it is better to postpone piercing it until its digestion has been confirmed according to what we have said; for if you pierce an abscess before this time, the body's disease will be prolonged and perhaps spread, and its membranes may harden or deepen.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	Some boils are pierced according to the depth of the flesh or body part, depending on necessity, or due to that which afflicts the affected limb.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you must administer a small piercing for the smaller boils, and larger piercings or multiple sections for the bigger ones depending on their size.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	Other boils are those in which the incision must be concave and cut, when it is done so that pus may flow out and has already matured enough to do so; like the ones that occur in herds of cattle and sheep.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	Those which are incised with three sides have sharp edges; and those that are cut in the shape of a myrtle leaf are like the boils of falconers.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And for those in which you administer a circular or crescent-shaped incision, it is similar to the aforementioned.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But for the one who has no such boils that are merely superficial, you must pierce them with a shallow or flat piercing only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the boil is large and has already collected a good amount of pus, you must pierce it without hesitation and remove all the rot at that very moment; once you have extracted some from it, cover the boil with something else by the next day, then extract more pus in succession until it is healed.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	Here is my attempt at translating the provided text:

De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Regarding the incision of scrofula, which occurs on the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Small white pimples appear, causing these abscesses on the neck, armpits, and groin; in some cases, they occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat. E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is important to be cautious not to cut or injure any veins or nerves.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	Whether the sputum is not formed or your hand cannot make an incision without disturbing the patient and you incise something that does not need to be cut, if you have cut a vein or artery and prevent yourself from completing the operation, put on the wound powdered vitriol or other powders that stop blood flow, squeeze it, let it rest for some time until the sharpness of the abscess is relieved and the wound has softened and begun to suppurate.

De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	The incision of the abscess (apostema) in the throat.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients called this incision in the abscess an 'epilhot', but I have not seen anyone perform it in our region.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the beginning of their speech:
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	When there is a curvature in the patient's neck, it is advisable to avoid extracting the abscess, as this could damage all their veins and major arteries.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	For those with abscesses in their mouth, throat, or ears, when the illness is not severe, it is necessary to use the 'epilhot' incision to prevent the harm that occurs from perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we wish to do this, it is important that we incise the 'epilhot' below the three circles of the abscess, or four times with small sections for its width in cases where there are two abscesses, ensuring the incision is shallow and not deep into the cartilage. This location is suitable for an incision as it lacks flesh, and the patient's blood vessels are far away.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	Here is my line-by-line translation of the provided medieval medical treatise: 
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then make an incision in the neck as we have described; this signifies sectioning of the channel with a flame, which is seen to be that from him who is disemboweled and by the removal of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	When the hour is considered appropriate for perforation to take place, add two lips of the chain to the wound, and stitch only if cartilage is affected.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	Then administer medicines that promote the growth of flesh so it may heal.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the summary of this speech we have recounted is nothing more than veins where some of these apostemes have already ruptured the patient's throat, and the patient has come back to life, and their soul has returned, and some wish to make an incision in the epiglottis so that the patient can breathe over the wound for a while, and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this reason I order the wound to be left open until the corruption of the disease is consumed; and its corruption lasts three days; then I will command such treatment of the wound, and it shall heal.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit. Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, I confessed that it had not cut any veins or arteries, and the wind was exiting from the wound. I treated it until it healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And the maid did not suffer any damage to her vocal cords, and in just a few days she returned with an improvement in her condition.

De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Regarding the incision for an abscess that occurs outside the groin area, it is called a groin hernia.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess called a groin hernia is a large one according to the description of its size in relation to the body, and it occurs more commonly in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	It happens in two ways: either naturally or accidentally.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	In the case of a naturally occurring abscess, it is not easy to treat.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	The accidental abscess occurs in two ways: one is similar to fat knots, and the other way is like an abscess caused by the blockage of an artery. In this case, there is fear or concern.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And it is not necessary to make an incision with iron unless in someone who is young.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	If you examine it and find it similar to fatty tumors, and it is not suspended by any of the veins, then you shall make an incision in those places like nodes, and remove it along with what contains its skin and subcutaneous tissue; but if not, thoroughly investigate its entire structure, and then treat the area with appropriate curative substances until it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On the incision of different types of nodules.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are several varieties of nodules, and I have already mentioned all the different kinds in this section.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	It is necessary for me to recount here the distinction between nodules and exostoses, in case there is any doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Thus I say that with exostoses there is a fever and violent pains, as the superfluous matter boils up; and it is a perfect state of putrefaction which ceases when the fever, pain, and heat subside.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	There is no heat or fever present, and you can consider this as a case of what we call 'leucophoenicum', which belongs to the cataplectic disease.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	According to the color of the body (or skin), its onset is like a boil and it happens just like with cows, whether major or minor, and they are of two types: either fatty and containing moisture, and the colors of this moisture are many, as I mentioned in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you reach the treatment of nodes, first express that and inquire about it at its beginning using an instrument called a probe, according to how its form will be revealed in the appropriate upcoming chapter.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	This is the method of inquiry for boils and all nodes: you take this instrument (the probe) and insert it into the wettest part that you find in the boil, then you will rotate your aforementioned words little by little until you know that the instrument has penetrated the core.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	Then close your hand according to the size of the boil and extract the probe, then consider what has come out in its track.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if you forget about draining the running moisture, regardless of its color, then you should cut it with a shallow incision, just as I have mentioned for other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no moisture found in the wound, then you should know that it is greasy.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry it over the wound with an incision in the shape of a cross, following this form:" (presumably referring to a visual representation that would accompany the text).
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	As I have taught you, suspend it with threads, and scrape off the crust from all around easily, preserving the skin or sack if possible over it and extract that pus with a thread.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it breaks during the operation, and you cannot extract that pus, often this happens, then you must remove it in pieces until there is nothing left.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if even the smallest amount of pus remains, the thread will return as it was before.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish to ensure that no part is left behind, complete the plague with some sharp corrosive powders and tighten the bandage, placing it over the abscess until it is healed, then treat it with another cure so that it may be cured.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is not large, then you stitch its two lips and treat it with something that incarnates.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	If the pulse is contrary, whether pulsatile or not, you cauterize and fill the place with powdered vitriol, leaving it tight for two or three days until the ulcer matures and blood no longer oozes; then return to cut away what is rotten from the tumor.

De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	On the forms of instruments necessary for section and perforation.

E aquestas so las formas dels experientz, e son nompnatz albered, e un de aquels es apelat berid.	These are the different forms of treatment, known as 'albereds', and one such form is called 'berid'.

E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri. The ends of these instruments are sharp on one side and dull on the other; they have not been placed in this way, but so that when used in the incision of nodes there is less risk to veins or nerves, and so that with them the patient can be cured, regaining tranquility after some time because of the drying out of the aposteme.

Las formas de ventozas am las quals es abscindit le flux del sanc, e so de tres specias; gran, migiera e pauca; las formas de lu:	The forms of cupping that interrupt the flow of blood are of three types; large, medium and small.
Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	They should be made from lemon tree bark, round with some length to them, and thin.
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	And ensure that these three types of cups are large, medium and small, so you can interrupt the blood flow at different rates as needed, especially when it is not yet time for medicine to be administered.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	However, do not use them to interrupt blood flow in any location of the body; only in fleshy places such as thighs and hips, forearms and upper arms, breasts, abdomen, knees and other similarly moist, fleshy areas.
E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.	And sometimes these instruments are made smaller and shaped like small boxes for bloodletting when performing phlebotomy or making incisions in veins or arteries.

Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	From treating the mammilla of men which are similar to those of women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some men's mammilla become swollen due to the effect of sleeping in damp places; and their mammilla are also similar to those of women, but more prominent and larger.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	For those who wish to perform this operation, it is necessary to make an incision in the mammilla following this lunar shape, from point .B. to point .G., and then carefully remove all the tissue. Fill the wound with red medicine, close the two edges of the wound using sutures, and treat them until they are healed.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the mammilla hangs towards the sides and is softened by its own weight like those of women, then it should be cut into two halves along its upper part, with two sections similar to a lunar shape, each one contained within the other at their ends, so that the larger line contains the smaller one following this shape from point .B. to point .G. Then carefully remove the tissue between the edges of the wound, taking out the fat, and administer what we have said about sutures and powders as necessary for the treatment until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.

De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	De perforacion de apostemas que viene debajo del tilleta.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These abscesses that develop below the ear belong to a type of scrofula which is hard and contains pus.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And among these, some contain moisture; for those that contain moisture, it is necessary to make an incision with the moon in a waning phase, according to this figure: from point G to point B. And when all the pus inside the abscess has been evacuated, you fill it with old beef tallow and let it settle over the next day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	Then keep the tallow there and treat it with appropriate ointment until it is healed.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment. May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	But if the plague has spread so that suppuration occurs, then apply cauterization as we have mentioned before.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49. (Or perhaps: "Title 49.")
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the incision of abscesses that occur on an artery or a vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor. Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text:
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	Here is the translation of the provided sentence:
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then pierce the place which is between two ligaments with a spatula so that the blood within it drains out, and let the abscess be dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a cure in which is generated a poultice so that the ligaments fall away, and then treat it with appropriate ointments until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is an abscess due to the incision of a vein, you should ensure that you have at hand what is necessary for treating the abscess with a ligature; then insert the needle under the place which you had beneath your hand, and make it penetrate; and let there be on it a thread so that you extract it from the other side, and then bind the abscess with a bandage as I told you in the chapter regarding grapes, with two parts at both ends of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that the thread will be pulled out, insert the sinew with that needle under the entire abscess up to where the first needle was inserted; and tighten your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the abscess in its middle part until what is inside it comes out; then you cut the excess of the ligature, and leave what remains tied.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then place on them a poultice that you have submerged in wine and oil, and then administer the cure which is made with compresses and ointments until they are healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 1: On abscesses that occur due to nerve injuries.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Similarly, abscesses can occur in arteries and veins, and similarly, abscesses can form in nerves when there is an injury or damage to their path or due to excessive strain and similar causes.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	Most often, they occur in the areas of the assistants or tendons, or any location where joints are compressed.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a severe abscess, similar in appearance to the rest of the body, and it is located in their joints or extremities; when it is very tight, causing intense pain, the patient experiences a similar stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	It is not an abscess that forms in the depths of the body; therefore, it cannot be cured with incisions. It is compressed from all sides and does not affect the areas in front or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Thus, for those who suffer from joint problems, it is not advisable to use iron tools [for treatment], as they could easily cause contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	If there is a small abscess, then take your scissors and cut it off from its roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, you will hang a weight on it, pull it out and then remove it; after that, stitch the wound with suture, and treat until it heals.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 11:
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	On the incision of an abscess that occurs on the cheek which affects the abdomen.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Treating some men who have spots on their bellies and in other parts of the body which are called funguals due to their similarity with fungi; the roots of these are thin while the head is thick; already the lips of those are transformed, it is from them that small ones come out, and great ones emerge as well.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	I have seen one patient like this, and in their belly there were two parts which looked more like fungi, and there was no difference between them as they were all white and had thin roots.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the lips of those patients were inverted and cracked, with moisture running from them constantly.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, I make an incision here and remove part of the foot, one with 18 ounces and the other with six.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And during the operation, when making an incision on them, consider whether the patient is moist and if the color of the hernia is white, humid, and with subtle roots. Then, you make an incision with a wide spatula, and have your cauterizers heated in the fire because many times their section expels a lot of blood; and if the blood comes out, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see that the patient is weak and fearful, be careful not to use iron for the incision; instead, take a recently made lead weight and tighten it around the hernia as we have described earlier, and leave it there for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Then tighten it with the lead wire's tension; so, do not stop tightening the large lead until it is cut and falls off by itself.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if it is of thick roots, then its incision is a cause for concern and fear, especially when it is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	It is also possible that you divide him in half and then cauterize it so that he doesn't return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	Then cure the patient until the plague is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be careful not to presume to cut into flesh that is of a dark color, has little sensation, and looks unhealthy, as it is actually cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will come with the memory of illness soon after this.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the cure for an umbilical hernia.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	An umbilical hernia is caused by multiple reasons: fissures in the muscle that lies above the abdomen, similar to other ruptures; or bleeding from a vein or artery as previously mentioned; or trapped gas.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	If it is due to a fissure in the muscle and the hernia appears, the colour of the wound resembles that of flesh; its pain is fierce and it appears in various places.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is due to the protrusion of the intestine (hernia), then place him in the position we have described with greater care and diversity, and as you press on it with your hand and it becomes hidden, return his intestines; do so gently and carefully, and remember that great danger comes from bathing and hard labor.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	If it is due to moisture (humidity), then it is less severe and not hidden when you press it with your hand; it is not constricted nor believed to be a serious condition.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to blood (an issue with circulation), then you will notice these signs: the appearance of an abscess turning black.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	If it is due to flesh (a soft tissue issue), then the abscess will be more severe, thick, and hard; it is embedded deep within.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	If it is due to gas (gas-related issue), then its touch will be gentle.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	The operation on such a case is considered if the bulge around the navel is due to arterial blood, venous blood, or gas; you should be warned against treating him/her because there is fear and danger involved, as I have taught you in the chapter where we discussed abscesses caused by arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have removed the cloth, then take a thread; and cut off its excess.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your bow or vein, then surround that area with a thread, and return to your operation; take two needles and put strong threads through them, and insert the two needles into the circle you have made around the abscess in the form of a cross, making sure they penetrate; then tighten the abscess into four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and leave the area so that the flesh can extend and fall on its own; or cut it when it has softened and will fall off, then treat it with something appropriate for wounds until it is healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the prominence of the navel is made of flesh or due to moisture, then it is necessary that you treat the abscess as we have said and draw out the blood or moisture that has collected there, then treat it with something appropriate and consolidate the area.
Capitol .liii.	It seems you have provided me with a chapter number from this medieval medical text. Is there anything else I can help you translate or understand?
De curacio de cranc.	That translates to "On the treatment of fractures." Would you like me to continue translating this text?
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already stated, in the division of special ailments and how they can be treated with medicine, that it is advisable to avoid treating them with iron as this could lead to ulceration; we have also mentioned the types of ailment generated by moisture and the precautions needed for their treatment.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	The ancient masters said that some ailments can be eradicated if they are caught in the early stages when it is possible to do so; this applies to ailments such as those found on the breasts or groin and similar areas of the body where it may be necessary to remove all affected tissue, especially when the ailment is still small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when the ailment is old and severe, it is best not to attempt treatment yourself, for I have not seen any cure for such an affliction nor do I know of anyone who has been successful in treating it.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	The operation on the patient, as we have mentioned earlier, should proceed like this: you prepare the patient and administer a black bile purge in some cases; then you proceed to bleed them, unless there is an obvious obstruction.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	Then prepare the patient for surgery, and use suitable hooks to reach into the wound; finally, remove all tissue with a good curved knife while ensuring you do not damage any of its roots.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	Let the blood flow and do not stop it lightly; squeeze the areas [to promote bleeding] and wipe away any large clots using your hand or an instrument that is suitable for you.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	If it is unpleasant for you to have large clots when incising a vein or an artery, then cauterize that area once the blood flow has ceased and then treat it with another remedy until it is healed.

However, without more context or additional information, I cannot determine the exact meaning of this chapter numbering.
De curacio de ydropici.	On the treatment of dropsy." 
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	E aquella la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	Here is my translation of the provided source sentence: 
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	If the generation of hydrops is due to kidney disease, then your incision should be three fingers to the left of the navel.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if its generation is due to the belly, then your incision should be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And you should not make your incision over the side on which the patient wishes to lie, so as not to let superfluities flow to that place.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	Then pierce it with the instrument through the entire length, then introduce this into that incision, and lift your hand with the spatula between the length and the cecum, and peel it off; if its quantity is of one claw or around.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	Then pierce the cecum until the spatula reaches the empty place, which is where water lies.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then extract it and introduce an instrument of this form:" (I cannot insert images, so please describe the image to me instead.)
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	It is similar to a thin silver cannula; it can be made of silver, bronze or lead. At its lower part there is a small hole, and on its sides three holes: two on one side and one on the other. Its extremity is incised like a pen, as you may see in this figure:" (please describe the image to me).
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	Here is the translation of the first source sentence: 
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	May it be expelled from that person according to the quantity of their virtue, and depending on what your understanding of the patient's condition is regarding their virtue and well-being.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	Then remove the instrument and keep the water that is causing this, which was just retained by the chain that holds the perforation above the navel, and show me how you perforated it in such a way.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And then repeat the procedure with the instrument on another day if you think the patient can bear it, and extract a small amount of water each time, doing so for several days out of fear that an excess may lead to error.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	If you fear that the patient may suffer due to a large amount of water being extracted, then treat them with poultices of warm dry sand, and apply sweet-smelling ointments while they are in a bath exposed to the sun for a long time; and finally provide them drying medications until they have healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	Cauterize the stomach, and the melon and kidney afterwards with an extraction of water, as I have described in what was previously written.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 50. 
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	For the cure of children who are born with unpenetrated urine passages.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Some infants are born from their mother's womb, and the head of their genitals is not perforated (either it is too narrow or is not in its place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Thus, it is necessary to make an incision on him as soon as he is born with a very thin spatula in this manner:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	Then place in the narrow opening a thin leaden peg and tie it there with thread for three or four days.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when he wants to urinate, he should be turned over to do so; then return him (to his original position).
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not tie the leaden peg in place, it is possible that urine flowing over this area will loosen and remove the peg.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	For one whose opening is too narrow, he should be treated with a leaden peg as we have said for many days until it (the peg) becomes wider.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	For those in whom the opening is not in its place (too high), it should be noted that this condition occurs when one is born with an upward-turned penis so that he cannot urinate when lying down because he raises his penis with his hand while doing so; and it is also a problem for reproduction, as semen cannot reach the mother properly. It is a very serious illness.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Capitol .lvi.	Capitol .lvi.:
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Here is my best attempt at translating your provided text into English, line by line: 
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And one of these is malignant, while the other is not.
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	For the non-malignant one, take a thin needle and cut it open so that everything inside is exposed; then apply some Egyptian ointment underneath it; finally, cure it with fine ointment until it is healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	If the ulcer is malignant with a dark colour, you must apply a hot iron to its incision and reason.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	But if the ulcer is on the foreskin of an uncircumcised penis, and one part of it is inside the foreskin while the other is outside, you must remove the ulcer that is inside at its beginning until it is consolidated; then treat what's outside, for when you treat what's under the foreskin together, there is no guarantee that it won't be torn.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And if this accident happens in the eyelids and foreskin, becoming black and corroding, you must dig up all that is already darkened and tends to corrupt or is already corrupted; then lay on it something mixed with honey, which has been bruised with a mixture of pomegranate rind and finely-sifted earthworms.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And then treat him with another cure until he is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	But if there is an outflow of blood, then apply the lunar cautery in this way:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	As the beneficial cautery has two uses, it is for bleeding and for corrupt wounds.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the penis is corroded and destroyed suddenly, you should insert a lead cannula into the flesh of the foreskin so that the patient urinates through it.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the case of an adhesion between the foreskin and the head of the penis (and this only occurs in those who have not been circumcised, as there is no need for it; and when it happens due to a wound or abscess) you should scrape with a blunt spatula until the adhesion is dissolved and the head of the penis is freed from any division.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to separate them completely, you should scrape with a spatula at the edge of the head of the penis and the foreskin; and this is why, when the foreskin is thin, it is easily pierced by its own thinness.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	And then separate the foreskin from the head of the penis using a very thin thread, which has already been moistened in cold water so that it does not stick again.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And then clean the wound with astringent vinegar until it is fully healed.
