E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And if the opening is wide, then you should join its lips with a suture and leave enough space for the enema to enter.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening from which the arm escapes is elevated towards higher parts, then dry that in its lowest part so that the arm can slide out of it, for when the arm is trapped in the depth of a bend, flesh will form within.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the bend around its lowest surroundings, then you must prepare the member with a preparation that makes the arm slide out of it easily as it suits you and that does not hold back the arm in any way.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Take consolidating medicines, which should be placed on the bend suitably for what you want to do; extend them over a piece of linen.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And let the piece of linen be so large as to cover all of the bend; and then cut with scissors, right at the opening of the bend, a slit somewhat wider than that opening; and then extend over another fire-colored linen bandage according to the size of the incision, place it on top far from the opening of the bend so that arm movement is limited and you do not have to remove the large piece of linen but rather wait several days at once.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	Now for the one who is on top of the sinus opening, you restrain him at all times so that he does not pull out what is inserted into his arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And to know whether what runs from his arm is too much or too little, whether it is digested or not digested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And you consider the area of that sinus, whether the patient feels pain there or not, and if there is an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment is prolonged in this way, and you see that the material which is placed over the sinus opening has already adhered, or if there is proper adhesion, then on the third day you remove the bandage and change it for a new one. When changing the dressing, renew the ointment as well.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if around the sinus there is a thin transparent discharge, then do not remove the adhesion of it because their healing is appropriate; for only some people take time to grow flesh on their wounds and others are those in which this is reversed.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if from the sinus much time passes without digestion of discharge, then you know that there is no adhesion in it; and if the adherence to the sinus is delayed for a long period, then reduce the moistness of medicines, and if they are moist by nature but dried up as ointments like *dryophytic* when applied with too much fat.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel. E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu. De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione. 
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	Certainly! Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if corruption has already reached the bone, then you must saw into the bone and extract it, for there is no cure when the corrupted bone remains.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the corruption spreading to the fingers, then you must cut into one of them according to its severity and properly treat it until healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	However, if the nail suffers trauma or injury and develops severe pain, then you must first perform bloodletting on the patient, and then dry up the nail using a sharp spade-shaped tool with a transverse section, ensuring that the incision does not go beyond the flesh beneath the nail, as this will cause intense pain to the patient and may lead to excessive scarring. Afterwards, treat the area with something soothing.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	This deformity of the fingers, which is naturally fleshy and often lacks bones or nails in some people.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	Some of them are born at the base of a joint, or their deformity is located in certain fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	Now, the deformity that affects certain fingers does not harm its owner, but one that is born at the joints often brings pain.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those who are born with fleshy bodies, their section is light, and you must cut their flesh with a wide spatula.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	For someone born with a deformity in the root of their joints, healing is difficult; therefore, beware of cutting them.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But for those born with a defect in their bones, it is necessary that you cut the flesh around them with a round incision at the beginning and then saw [the bone] with one of those appropriate saws, and afterwards treat the wound until it heals.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	But for the consolidation that occurs in said wounds caused by hidden motives or due to the nature of man, or by the consolidation of a plague, or by fire, then it is necessary to cut off this consolidation so that they return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And place the patient between sheets soaked in rose oil so that their wounds are not easily consolidated (i.e., hardened), and separate them with layers or a thin lead sheet until they are consolidated as required.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	Similarly, if consolidation occurs in the palm of someone's hand, then you must cut off this consolidation according to what is required and suitable for the shape of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore, you must administer a purge for black bile occasionally with great force, and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The treatment for their iron disease is according to two methods: one is that it should be incised and the black blood should be drawn out, and the other method is that the vein should be raised and everything extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision is done in this way: immerse the leg at its beginning in cold water for a long time until the thick blood is dissolved, which is feculent from the leg, and then bind the patient's leg to the highest part of the thigh down to the lower part with a bandage, and then dry the vein in one place, or two, or three with a wide incision, and then draw up the black blood gently by hand from below the leg upwards, and downwards again until you extract as much blood as desired and however often it is needed, and which removes the illness from the patient.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then bind it up, and command them to abstain from foods that generate black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the cure by phlebotomy when the veins are full, as he notices.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then bind the wound on the right side of the vein by cutting in its length or at its rear towards their back, or if it is lower down cut around the ankle.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then open the wound with hooks and scrape out the vein entirely until you feel it, and there should be an appearance of him which you will see is turning black.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And thus when you evacuate and from the wound you see it turn white as if it were a cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then place beneath it the reed until it is raised and turned away from the wound, and suspend it with linen cloth.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then make another cut close to that cut by three fingers, and scrape the wound from where it started above the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then lift it up and cut it at the rear of that second section near the ankle, and then pull it out and raise it through the second incision, and finally extract it from the section above.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	Do this until you extract it from the section that is most superior or highest of all sections, once they are all exposed; and then cut it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	Here is the translation of your provided text:
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	Make sure it is not cut; for if it is broken, you will find it difficult to lift that part and it has come upon the patient due to this harm.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Once that entire area has been cleaned, place on the site of the wound a poultice submerged in wine and both rose oil and non-rose oil; treat it until cured.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	If the vein is contracted and has twisting at which it wraps around the limb, but does not follow straightness as we have said before, then you should cut through that area completely and its binding locations; and then attach a weight on it until the whole thing is raised.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And take care not to cut into the vein while you are making this incision and do not apply anything there, for it will be difficult for you to lift that part again; let your prudence guide you in this.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The shape of the cutting instrument for drying out the vein:
Forma de unci orp:	Shape of a dead weight:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It should not have a sharp point like dead weights nor should it be of an acutely pointed end so as not to pierce the vein and cause harm; instead, let its flexibility be thick, for if it were thin, it would cut into the vein due to its thinness; therefore, its thickness is excessive in this way as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	De extraccio venae cruris translates to "For the extraction of the leg vein." 
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs, in low-lying lands such as Al-Ategi in the land of the Arabs and in the low and arid regions of India that have little vegetation and where there are neither grass nor trees.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And rarely is it generated in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	Its gestation comes from the process of putrefaction, which is similar to how snakes and worms, as well as terrifying and disgusting creatures, enter the body through wounds, breeding between the pus and flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	A sign of the onset of this disease is the occurrence of intense inflammation in the leg, and the area becomes blistered. Then, from the location of these blisters, a vein begins to emerge, resembling the root of a plant.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	Once the disease appears, you should take a piece of lead weighing one to two drachmas and attach it to the leg, letting the lead hang loosely.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	Whenever the disease causes any movement outside of the leg, wrap this lead around the affected area and secure it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	So it is necessary that it be treated rigorously and extracted little by little, while being flushed out from the back of him so as to remove any cause in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, it is said to have appeared in some men who had it for the length of 5 to 10 palms and it has come to my attention that one man's was even at 20 palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised at the hour of its medication, then insert a hollow rod through it and perforate that with a long tube into the body, until all that is in the matter is evacuated, and apply putrefaction to the place for some days with medicine; and then treat it for the cure of apostemes.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And sometimes this vein has many bumps, and mostly when it appears at the joint of the foot or on the foot, and comes to him many openings, and is said that from each opening a branch.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And so cure it as we have said in the division and with what is above said.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	On the section about worms generated under the skin and it is called bovine illness.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This ailment is named in some regions as 'bovine disease' because many cases come from cows and there is a worm that is born between the sinew and the flesh, which travels throughout the body up and down, and it is shown by its movement from limb to limb until it breaks the sinew and comes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	Its generation is due to the putrefaction of certain humors, which can lead to the appearance of worms, serpents, and larvae such as pinworms and threadworms in the abdomen.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	It is feared for its malice because when it reaches the brain and elevates to the head, it then comes into the eye, causing rupture in it, and this leads to many instances of blindness.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	Therefore, when you want to cure and extract it, it should not be done without first observing its movement and appearance through touch; you must then tightly hold what is above the affected area with one hand and apply strong pressure underneath using a ligature or something similar that constricts; finally, cauterize over it and remove whatever comes out.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is deeply embedded in the flesh and you cannot find it, then place a red-hot cauterizer on the area until it dies; its greatest danger lies in corruption which spreads to the surrounding areas as we have mentioned.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	May you see that the patient has reached a critical stage of illness near death, then apply pressure on their forehead with force and hold it tightly there, and extract [the cause]; and ensure that the patient uses purgatives to evacuate harmful, foul humors from their body, and avoid food that causes putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	On treating inflammation of the naval.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This illness is called 'nafir' in our region, a pain that affects some body parts and moves from one part to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And I have already seen her, as I will recount to you shortly.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to attend a sick woman in a village; I examined her arms and noticed a small inflammation on the main vein of her arm, which had been crushed for an hour; as I watched it, the inflammation moved up towards this side more lightly than one would think possible, much like liquid silver running from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then I removed the pain from that place and placed it in her muscle; here I sit for another hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then it runs into the other body until it reaches the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	Then I began to observe him as he moved throughout his body, just as I had seen before; and I was incredibly amazed by the interchangeability of parts and the speed at which they could move from one member to another.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	I had seen this before in my experience, though I have witnessed many cases where the pain was transferred from one member to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	I have not seen this in my eyes like so, as it is with the woman's body.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not think it was anything but this, for the woman is elderly, with dry skin and visible veins; in this case, one can feel that transferred wind.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	It is necessary that this treatment not be performed on those who are young and have moist bodies with full veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And if you wish to treat the patient's pain and it is not apparent to your sense of smell as previously mentioned, then you must press upon them gently and firmly over the area where the wind has been trapped, and cauterize that place.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquellas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.
De extraccio de sagetas.	De extraccio de sagetas means "On the extraction of arrows." or "Arrow removal process".
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Sagetas (arrows) are diversified according to their types and the parts of the body they target, as their diversity lies in those with large points, small ones, curved, blunt, solid ones; and those that have three edges, some with tongues, and others with barbs.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	The arrow that is according to the body parts and members it strikes does so in two ways: either it hits principal organs such as the brain, heart, liver, lungs, kidneys, intestines, bladder, or similar; therefore when an arrow pierces any of these members and you perceive signs of death, which I will recount shortly, then it is best that you avoid extracting that arrow from those whose deaths are most likely to come swiftly, and when such ill omens do not appear to you, nor the arrow hidden deep within a member, then extract said arrow and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	Regarding the signs of a wound to the brain: when an arrow pierces it and passes through the bone there will be a violent headache, blindness, dizziness, ringing in the ears, inflammation and pain in the tongue, spasms and confusion, vomiting bile, speech becomes slurred and voice lost, white liquid resembling dust seeps from the area of the wound, and the flesh around seems to melt.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And so if these signs appear to you, then abstain from the cure and extraction of the arrowhead, unless it is essential.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the signs of the arrowhead when lodged in the heart are such: it is close to the left nipple, and you feel that it has struck a hard object, and it is not a visible wound; moreover, the movement of the arrowhead is similar to the pulse, and there is a discharge of black blood, along with coldness in the extremities, shallow breathing, and fainting; therefore, know that death descends swiftly upon them.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrowhead has pierced the lung are an effusion of frothy blood from the wound, and the veins near the neck become inflamed, there is a change in the patient's complexion, they exhale a great spirit (breath), and crave cold air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	If the arrowhead has struck the covering (membrane) that is in the foot, and the pain then moves towards the little toes, causing a great swelling with intense pain and sighing, but not affecting all the limbs or muscles.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrowhead has struck the stomach, in some cases you will see undigested food coming out of the wound.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	Here is the translation of your provided text:
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	Here is my best translation of the provided text: 
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will recount this to you based on what I have witnessed regarding the nature of these arrows, so that you may understand its significance in terms of mild cures.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	Which is caused by an arrowhead becoming lodged in the tear duct of one's eye at the root of their nose; I extracted this arrow from another part of the body, leaving a graze on their ear, and they healed without any damage to their vision.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	Another arrow was removed from a Jew who had been shot in the eye, just below the eyelid, and the arrowhead was hidden deep within; only a small portion of the tip could be grasped which was attached to the shaft, it was one of those long pointed Turkish arrows with a lion's head but no ears.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	The Jew was cured, and his sight remained unimpaired without any harm to his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	I extracted yet another arrow from a Christian man who had been shot in the throat; it was an Arabic arrow with ears. I made two incisions over this arrow and as it was lodged deep within the throat, I had to be careful when extracting it. The Christian healed after its removal.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text into English: 
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	Here is my best attempt at translating the text line by line: 
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man into whose face an arrow had pierced; the wound was now healed but he felt no pain there and there were many like him.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	I extracted the arrow from the nose of the king's chief commander who had been wounded in the middle of his nose and it had already tilted slightly to the right, and all of the arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called to treat him just three days after the wounding of the arrow.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	So I discovered that the wound of the arrow was very narrow and then I inquired about this subtle sensation which he did not feel but only when I touched below his right ear; so I suspected that it must be caused by the point of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I plastered the area with an attractive and digestive ointment hoping that the wound would become inflamed so as to show me where the arrow was located in order for it to dry out.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	But I did not find any significant evidence that the arrow had reached that place and so I continued applying the ointment for many days but nothing happened; meanwhile, the wound became healed while the patient suffered from sneezing over several days until one day I felt the arrow inside his nose and he told me about it.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then I applied an acute corrosive medicine to the wound for several days until it was open and accessible, carefully probing it with my fingers, and removing the delicate tip of the arrowhead which adhered to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	Then I carefully packed the wound with the acute medicine while still inside it so that the tip of the arrowhead became visible to me, and I gave this treatment to them over four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And because the wound was still enlarged, and it seemed feasible to introduce a pair of pincers into it, I did so repeatedly without hesitation or interruption until such time as I began one day to manipulate some instruments of iron in the form of forceps that were specially made for this purpose, according to the description given at the end of this chapter; then removing them I cleaned the wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	Some physicians believed that the cartilage of the nose could not be restored; I did so and healed the wound perfectly, recovering this patient to full health with no further complications.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	I recommend to you the method of arrow extraction and give this rule and meaning for what I have not said because there is as yet neither description nor definition in any part of this book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	Here is the translation of the given text: 
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is drawn out from the place where it entered, or is an arrowhead embedded in flesh, and is pulled out and ejected.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if it does not obey the exit at the hour when you extract it, then leave it for a few days until the flesh around it decays and its attraction and exit are alleviated.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	Similarly, if it is embedded in bone and does not obey your extraction, then leave it for a few days and repeat the process of attraction and motion every day until it is ejected.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if it does not obey your extraction after a few days, then you must drill into the path of the arrowhead in that bone from all sides with a fine borer until the space around the arrowhead is widened, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrowhead is embedded in the bone of the head and has penetrated into one of the cavities of the brain, and the patient experiences some of those accidents I have mentioned before, then refrain from extracting the arrowhead and leave it there for several days until its being becomes equalized; for if the arrowhead reaches the vital center, then death is not prolonged for the patient.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	If it is very inflamed and does not obey your extraction, then you must apply taravels around the arrow's path as we have described earlier, and cure the area until it is healed.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow has penetrated deep into the chest and is beyond your reach, then you must search for it carefully using your fingers or any suitable instrument designed for such extraction.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot access it due to the tightness of the wound and the length of the arrowhead, especially when there are no major vessels or nerves involved in the path, then you must incise over the wound until it is sufficiently widened for you to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	For the extraction of an arrowhead lodged in or near the ears and holding onto some tissue there, you must first free that flesh from all around it with as much care as you can; devise means to accomplish this, if the ear's structure makes it impossible to simply release the trapped flesh at the fracture site by gentle traction and rotation without damaging the ear.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	During the extraction of an arrow from any location it may be lodged in, you must employ the torsion of your hand like a forceps at all possible angles to make it yield; being mindful and gentle so that the arrow does not break inside and cause difficulties for its removal.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	Under these circumstances you are not able to attend the patient immediately, then leave for a few days until all parts of the patient's body recover, and after that repeat this procedure when they feel better.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	If blood flow troubles you, then apply the cure we have mentioned in this chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	Remember your skill in incising veins or nerves, or even the cord, and apply every method you can to avoid arrow extraction; do so with ease, tranquility, gentleness, and firmness as I have taught you and demonstrated myself.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	Therefore, press against the arrow in a direction opposite to the penetration of the wound on the patient's body, as it is most beneficial according to this figure.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	If that is not feasible for you, then apply what is within your reach according to these figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	And the arrows that are bent outwards due to being contrary to another part, or when you have extracted some part from outside parts of the body, or if it causes joint dislocation upon moving the arrow upwards after feeling resistance in the wound below and sometimes even above; then saw through this; and be the cut according to the amount forceps can grip; and then pull on that, for it is lightened up by its removal.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	But if it is retained in the bone, then you must turn the limb according to its opposite direction until the arrowhead presses against the bone and pushes through it; and then extract that.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	Otherwise, leave it for several days, and then repeat the process until you extract it.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the arrow is still inside, then you must use your hand to push it through.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	But if the shaft has fallen out and you want to administer a push, then introduce your thumb into it, and if there is no orifice, use a concave tool so that its concavity fits over the tail of the arrowhead; and then push it through.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrow is concave, then push it through with a strong tool inserted into it because that will ease out the arrow.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is poisoned, then make sure that you hollow out all of the flesh around the wound if at all possible; and then treat it with whatever seems appropriate to you.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow has gone into the foot, or belly, or bladder, or side, and it is close enough that you can touch it with a tent peg, and it is possible for you to cut around it, then do so while taking care not to sever any veins or nerves; extract it, then stitch up the wound as seems necessary, and treat it until it heals.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	The way forceps are used when the arrows are shot:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Their ends are like a bird's beak, which is shaped like a saw when it grasps the arrow so that it doesn't let go.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And they are made in many special sizes—large, small, and medium—according to the size of the arrow and its thickness, as well as the width of the wound and the tightness of the surrounding tissue.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	The shape of the driving end is concave like a bird's beak to ease the entrance of the arrowhead into it and the push from the other end:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	The shape of the driving end is:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	Like a wedge to ease its entrance into the concave arrowhead and it is pushed by that.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	On venesection or phlebotomy of veins:
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins that are usually used for venesection and mentioned in chapter XVI are two pulse-like veins located near the ears, called 'alhasisain'; two herbs that appear on either temple; two veins situated under the eyes, named 'aspicientz'; a vein positioned at the center of the forehead; another one found at the tip of the nose; two veins on the neck; and two more each in the upper and lower lips. These are known as the 'angelic' veins. And there are also two veins below the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	Under the foot and leg there are three veins: one of them is below the curvature of the heel of wild flax; the second is sophena, its location being under the domestic flax's leg; and the sciatic vein, whose place is under the wild flax’s leg; in the leg there are other similar veins to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The treatment of veins near the ears is for ancient cataracts, immigration, and evil sores and ulcers on the head.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the method of bleeding those veins is as I recommend to you: it should be done on top of the patient's head, and the patient's head should be rubbed in the occiput at the location of both veins with a wide cloth with good friction; then tighten the patient's neck with a bandage between which shows both and their locations under the ears in two depressed parts of the head; and you feel that one with your finger, if you feel a pulse from those with your finger, there is a sign to try it.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then you take the lancet-like cutter, which is sharp, and then you place it under the vein in the elbow so that the phlebotomist comes to the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then lift your hand towards the vein and the groin area, make an incision in the vein with a sharp instrument.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	Let the length of the incision be about two fingers in size or thereabouts; and let out as much blood as you desire.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then strengthen it with powders, and allow it to heal.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	It has already been mentioned at the beginning of this book how to make incisions in them, as well as their cauterization.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	The two arteries which serve as the pillars of phlebotomy are: 1) The former (obsolete now and ill-advised), and 2) The latter is persistent and full of superfluous, sudden outpourings to the humours.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the way to perform phlebotomy on them is as follows, which I recommend to you: Constrain the patient's arm with a bandage so that the two veins are visible by tactile examination and can be palpated; their pulse will then be shown under your finger, at which point you proceed.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	Then you lift the groin area above the vein in the upper parts with your index finger, insert the sharp phlebotomy instrument underneath it, and raise the vein upwards; then make an incision as you have done with the other two veins before, letting out blood according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Underneath the patient's restraint, place your finger on their vein for an hour; then place cotton and lint on top of that area and press down with firm compression; let it heal.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	The memorization of their words has already been made prior to this text's incision and attraction at the beginning of the book.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	Therefore, the judgement of phlebotomy of the vein in the forehead is now phlebotomy of the cephalic vein for ancient facial illnesses, migraines, pain and foul ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of phlebotomy on him is as I recommend to you; it's that the patient tightens their collar with a bandage so that the vein appears; and then take the instrument which is named a fleam, this being its form: [diagram of instrument].
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Place the sharp point which is at the top of the fleam onto that vein and strike it with a hammer or another tool in the manner shown, and let the blood run according to the quantity you wish; then release the patient's restraint and press down on the puncture until it has healed.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	At times it is opened with a lateral phlebotomy, but be aware that this phlebotomy should not have an acute end like other phlebotomies; instead, its side must be sharp and the phlebotomy performed across the bone as it's very thick and a subtle phlebotomy would break.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	Sure, here is my translation of your first source sentence:
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	And regarding the procedure of bloodletting, it is necessary for the patient to strain their neck using a bandage, and then you will perform the phlebotomy, standing over their head.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	Once the phlebotomy is performed across the length of the vein with slight incision due to the lack of flesh in that area; if the phlebotomist is skilled, there will be little chance of breaking the tip.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Let the blood flow as much as you deem necessary, then place a cloth over the incision, bind it with a bandage for one night, and afterwards untie the binding.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	The phlebotomy of the vein in the nose is suitable for acute fever and violent headaches, as well as diseases of the face, migraines, and especially when these are chronic.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	The process of phlebotomy requires the patient to strain their neck and then offer their nose to you with their left hand; take your slender, long phlebotomist tool and place it in the middle of the top of the nose following its curvature, as the vein is not visible here and the blood will begin to flow immediately.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	Make sure you gradually remove your hand from the small bloodletting instrument and allow the blood to flow according to your needs; then tie it up for one night, as it heals lightly.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	However, the bloodletting from the two veins causes a contraction of bile and leads to the onset of leprosy and various other illnesses such as impetigo and bad corrosive ulcers, along with erysipelas.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	The nature of the bloodletting from these veins is that the patient should lie down on their back with a pillow under them; and let the practitioner stand by the patient's head, while the patient sits on a chair.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	Then, bloodlet from the vein along its length using a wide small instrument gradually; and extract blood in accordance with season, quantity or as often as needed for this; and do likewise to the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	Then untie the pillow and bind both veins with a light bandage to prevent suffocation of the patient, and leave it until morning as the wound is healing.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu. Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	But if you have any doubts about which one it is, then proceed with an incision into the larger of them and the more apparent one.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make two similar incisions on their upper lips.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	However, it is more common to make incisions on the two veins that are located under the lower lip.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	The two veins that are beneath the tongue aid in bloodletting for those suffering from excessive phlegm in the throat, inflammation of the uvula, and mouth diseases.
