E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	Then return the patient to his previous routine with which he was accustomed.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And when the broken bone starts to heal, it is advised that the patient be fed with nutritious foods of substantial weight and density like wheat porridge cooked in water, rice, cheese, beef stomachs, eggs, fresh fish, wine resembling those, and with this routine, fracture coagulation occurs more lightly and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	Know that broken bones in men who are either very young or elderly cannot be properly joined and consolidated according to their natural state due to the desiccation of their members.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	They are consolidated and joined according to their natural state at all times through the desiccation of those members, and they are particularly continued and consolidated in old age when bones lose their tenderness just like the bones of young children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature always adjusts and binds the broken bone with a substance similar to glue in its consistency which adheres and strengthens what was once divided but now glued together, until it reaches an end point of strength and firmness like fire at the beginning, while no cause prohibits it from completing its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And due to this reason, it is necessary that you restrict the diet of the patient; foods in which are heavy, viscous and coarse, as we have mentioned.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	There is a variety of fractures according to the different parts of the body.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fractures are varied depending on the different body parts; a fracture of the shinbone is different from that of the skull, and similarly, a fracture of the foot bone differs from that of the spine; likewise, all other bones are distinct from one another.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I shall provide you with a recollection of all the different types of fractures, presented in their own distinct chapter separate from the others.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	A variety of fractures within the same bone.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	The types of fractures within the same bone are diversified; there is an arcuate fracture and another that occurs in its sockets; some fractures occur along the length of the bone: such as comminuted, simple, compound and non-compound fractures, just like when a pen is prepared to write, or a depressed and disrupted fracture in the skull, or even a small fissure.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And it is necessary to use an iron tool or instrument for this specific operation, which will be explained in detail when we come back to the description of it.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Signs of bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And a bone fracture is known by the following signs: a twisting of it, and when there is a prominence or appearance upon feeling it, and also when you compress it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore, when there is no visible twist in the bone and upon touching it with gentle movement, the patient does not experience much pain, then it is not a fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that there might be a twist or small crack, in which case you should not squeeze it with your hand and with pressure of the whole; instead, place on it one of the medicines which will be described later at this very moment which is suitable for the location; and then bind it tightly with fine strips.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that when the location is arched and not divided into two or any other such thing which does not happen in soft tissues, as if it were dislocated on all sides of its form, then you must begin from this hour to rectify it before it becomes an ulcer.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if an abscess occurs, let it be left alone for a few days until the abscess subsides; then treat it according to any method you know of lightness and ingenuity.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	Be aware that the restoration of the patient and their cure is lighter than the bone where this happens.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen them according to when they will remember it.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the bone is affected, it is necessary to extend this broken limb by two parts, whether it be the hand or foot; or use your own hands if the limb is small; or with two ropes, or one rope and a hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And if it is the position you use to place the limb back into its natural shape while keeping the broken parts of the limb extended, then make sure to return those additions with ingenuity and according to any method that may be suitable for their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And be careful, according to your strength, not to cause the patient any pain or injury during your operation; and make sure that you apply one bone to its companion with all of your power so as to bring them together in their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And now it is necessary that in this hour you touch him with your hand and if you see any other cause, rectify it according to the quantity of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	Avoid violent extension and compression, as foolish doctors often do who cause festering sores by their operations, or bring about a contraction of the limb as we have seen in their cases.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	Then connect and equalize the movement of that limb, perform a careful operation and restrain it, providing rest and tranquility; warn the patient about this and make them avoid any harm to it during their waking hours or while sleeping, observing its reaction and agitation, taking care of all its movements with your whole power. And wait until you have ensured that when placed in such a position, there is no pain caused by injury or damage, which happens because sometimes the limb feels painful or sore when arranged in certain positions; then it should be moved to another position where there is no pain. Be careful not to twist the limb out of shape as it returns.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	The quality of the restraint for a broken limb is as I have described it here; you should know that broken limbs are diverse in their size and greatness, and also in how they break.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those who are smaller, like the arm, wrist, and fingers, it is recommended that the wrapping be made of very soft cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	For those who are larger, such as the thigh or leg, it is necessary that their wrapping be made of tough and rigid material, for a hard bandage firmly connects this large limb with tight pressure all around, so that no blemish may enter.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	Then begin by immediately starting your evacuation of excrement, placing a suitable pad on the location of their injury with three or four wrappings according to how much you think this limb deserves; gently tighten these with your hands.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And so you will see that at the highest point of this area where their bone is broken, it should be less tightly bound than what you have applied to the fracture site.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	Then extend the wrapping slightly above the fracture site, loosening it little by little as you move away from this area.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	Take another bandage and wrap it around this second layer above the fracture site, then reach for your first layers of wrapping from below; perform the same operations as we mentioned before, tightening and loosening these wrappings accordingly.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then place between the folds of the patient's leg a lion skin or cloth that matches the curvature of the fracture, if there is any curvature; otherwise, do not apply anything to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then place another bandage over it, and shape this wrapping appropriately with stitches that are made correctly as well, if there is no inflammation or abscess present in the area, but instead apply this to the abscess itself and drain the inflammation; leave it for a few days, and later you can tighten the stitches.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	Whether the stitches are made with half of a reed each, or they have been skillfully crafted; perhaps they are made from wooden sticks; or from palm tree branches; and let their width be in accordance with this form and figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, take care that the stitch which is applied over this fracture should be thicker and slightly smaller than the other stitches, and let its length match the size of the limb in terms of width; then tighten these stitches with another bandage according to your initial procedure; next, bind it above with adequate thread following what was said about tightness, so that the tightness of the binding is according to the location of the fracture more or less, such that the greater its distance from the fracture, the lesser the tightness.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And now it is necessary that the threads be finer in thickness and softer in material, and if they are too thick, as I have seen some fools do by using cords from their own clothing, this is a great mistake when considering how tight a suture must be.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And using fine threads is not suitable because you will not achieve the necessary tightness with them, and it should be ensured that there are less than a finger's width between each suture.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is delicate due to the ends of the sutures being close to their extremities, then place soft linen or wool padding underneath so as not to cause them injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture may be accompanied by an open wound, and in such cases there may be disruption of the skin's continuity; I will address this further in the following section on specific cases.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	Be aware that not all broken limbs can be immediately splinted on the first day; this is because when a limb is large, it should not be splinted until after several days have passed or up to a week, depending on your confidence in preventing development of an abscess.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is how poultices were applied in ancient times to restore fractures, dislocations, and sprains.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	The method of applying poultices as a quick fix for fractures is particularly suitable for complicated cases and mostly for women and children, as it does not require any heat or friction: simply take some fine powder, which is the flour that accumulates on the walls of the mill due to the movement of the millstone.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And this is indeed so, but sieve it with egg white and make the mixture neither thick nor thin; then use it.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method of poultice for treating fractures, dislocations, and sprains is to take one dram each of asafoetida, labdanum, acacia, elecampane, and wild millet root; five drams each of myrrh and aloe; twenty drams of aloeswood; all are to be crushed, sieved, and mixed with garlic water or egg white if the patient's condition is sensitive; then apply this poultice, as it has a good composition and helps heal slightly broken bones and is suitable for many men.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Here is my translation of the provided text into English line by line: 
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	Moreover in this plaster there is not placed a restorative herb, but an abscess-causing and pain-expelling poison.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another type of plaster that restores a blocked passage: take fresh leaves from the fig tree and leaves from the wild poppy; mix them all together and make a plaster out of them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Way of abbreviated plaster administered for the restoration of a broken bone and when you want resolution of the remainder of an abscess: take roots of marshmallow, chamomile, and viola flowers, bran flour, all divided equally; have them all chopped finely and mixed with wine (if the limb is not lacerated).
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is lacerated, then mix the paste with coriander water or water, then apply.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another type of very strong plaster for the resolution of a hard abscess during the restoration of a limb: take marshmallow roots and lily seeds, as well as flax seed, honeysuckle, marjoram, viola flowers, chamomile, all divided equally; have them all chopped finely and mixed with willow water or warm water or wine, all depending on the quality of the limb and the state of its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	In Wales, it has been observed that placing warm items on the broken limb contributes to its restoration and aids in healing; similarly, the application of substances like myrrh, alum, and others akin to those we have previously mentioned.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	The method of making a plaster to provide relief and alleviate pain: Take equal parts of crushed nuts, human hair clippings, bird dung, marshmallow root, and salt; grind and sieve these ingredients together, then create a plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	The duration for which the bandage should remain in place and when it can be removed depends on whether there is any pain, swelling, or an indication of a broken bone; if these symptoms are absent, you may leave the bandage untouched for several days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if the site exhibits severe pain, swelling, or inflammation, you should attend to it immediately; remove the plaster and tend to the wound.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	Take a soft cloth and a moist sea sponge, dip it in warm water, and use this to clean the affected area until any swelling or pain subsides; then allow the limb to rest for an hour. Afterward, place over it a layer of fine wool soaked in vinegar or rose oil, bind it with bandages for one night, ensuring you address any internal abscesses, reduce inflammation, and alleviate the patient's discomfort.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat that delicate compression and apply a small plaster without tightening the first bandage too much, let it be gentle as it heals.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you see that the abscess, redness, pain, inflammation, and all other symptoms have completely subsided, and there is no longer a need for plasters or compression, then repeat the same procedure as you did initially.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if there is no injury or damage to the affected limb that would require further attention as mentioned earlier, then do not remove the bandage for three to four days, or even five or seven; sometimes it can be left for up to twenty days depending on how quickly the healing progresses and the limb recovers its movement, as we have explained, allowing the fracture to heal properly and the flesh to knit together.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	Then adjust the bandage more tightly compared to the initial one you applied, taking into account the patient's condition and how their body has changed since then.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	If you notice that the fracture site has become drier and more calloused than before, understand that nourishment should be prohibited from reaching it. Therefore, moisten it with tepid water every time you remove the bandage; do this three times a day. Loosen the bandage slightly, and through this operation, blood circulation to the limb will improve, leading to faster healing.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text into English:
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen anyone among them do this, which is why it is more reasonable not to do so.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter Two: Regarding fractures that occur in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are numerous, and their forms are diverse, with distinct causes. Some fractures occur due to the impact of space, where the force completely shatters the bone within the skull, similar to how it occurs in the trunk or body; this type is named 'ascia.' Or, the space penetrates a part of the bone, piercing through the flesh but not passing beyond it into the interior; this kind of fracture is called 'levatio absoluta.'
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	The extent of damage in these two types of fractures can be significant or minor, and there is also the type known as 'contritio' or 'attritio.' This occurs due to the impact of a heavy object or a fall onto rocks, which are similar causes.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	This fracture can be penetrating, approaching the membrane beneath the bone, or it might be on the surface of the bone. The extent of damage in both these types of fractures can be extensive or minor.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz. E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And then use your hands to mould the fracture so that it takes on its proper shape and is not positioned in a prominent or concave area.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove. Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	However, if you feel cracks in the fork's bone and they are bad [unclear if mauguda is a medical term or an error in the source text], then it is necessary to make incisions over this area and remove those fragments with ease.

Since you have placed a fork underneath to support the tool used for this procedure; and this instrument can be made of wood or iron, depending on its shape.
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	It resembles a spoon with its concave shape and adjust the width of it according to what is needed for the size or thickness of the bone.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	Let the length of it be as convenient as possible for the operation and have two ends with one end being wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura. E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	If the wound is small or you are worried about pus forming, then fill the cavity with dressings and powders depending on the size of the wound.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	If pus does form, then soak a dressing in vinegar, rose oil and wine and place it over the affected area.

E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And make sure the star-shaped wound is not over the broken bone; and for this reason you must see the patient every day to check that when the binding has softened or if you see the star shaped wound become bigger, then you correct it and tighten the bandage.

De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	Spatula tart is broken at his/her side and is not broken from him/her but its edges are.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And when his/her place is broken - and it is broken in the middle of him/her - and it is not known except by touching, then according to what the figure of the fracture forces you, prepare yourself for its treatment and reduce that fracture according to its natural shape in every way possible.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	Then, place over the place powder of egg molars and galbanum; then place a cloth pad on top; finally, place a thin slice of waxed wood board according to the size of the whole spatula or slightly larger.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if you leave the board with a concave shape in some places of the spatula, then fill that concavity with galbanum pads, and raise the board to make it even.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	Then, strengthen it from above with long pieces of cloth tied tightly and secured firmly to the board so that it does not move from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	Pay attention to the bandaging each day; every time it becomes loose, tighten it again and secure it so that the board does not shift from its position.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And lay the patient onto his side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	The spatula is replaced after $20$ days or $25$.

De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	On the restoration of a broken foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And for the accidents that occur when his ribs are broken, he bends towards the inner parts and experiences great pain, difficulty breathing, coughing, strong fever, and vomiting blood; this is clearly visible as there is a cavity in the broken bone which can be felt.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	The restoration process involves turning the patient onto their stomach and placing a cushion under their shoulders; then press on their muscles and align their backbone with both hands gently during this operation as much as it is possible to do so in such a way that suits him, while restoring the bones to its original shape.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	Then place a plaster and compress on him and put some thin strips of willow or poplar bark or something similar underneath in an elevated position since you will wrap that with cloth; then carefully bind this onto the broken bone without doing any harm; tie it securely around his back according to its roundness, and ensure a decent tightness; thereafter inspect the bandage every hour and tighten it whenever it loosens.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if there is any need to provoke him into an unbinding of this due to the corrosion or itching, pain, or abscess that occurs in the area, then you must cut away and loosen the bandage and remove whatever it is that caused such symptoms by treating them accordingly; thereafter reduce the plaster, should his skin become affected; and restore tightness until he has healed.

E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And make sure that his understanding is not clouded by emotion when questioning him.

And the restoration should be such that it aligns the fracture with these said splints in the most feasible manner, while also ensuring it is aligned as required, then plaster and strengthen the broken bone with a star-shaped apparatus if necessary.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the fracture of the ribs extends to internal organs, it causes intense pain and piercing sensation for the patient, similar to what happens with pleurisy, which is why they cover the bones with a cloth; this leads to difficulty in breathing, coughing, and vomiting of copious amounts of blood; this condition is very challenging to cure.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And the ancients have devised many devices for such ailments.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	They say the patient's diet should avoid anything that induces inflammation and flatulence so as to prevent bloating or extension of the abdomen which could push the fracture onto external organs.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	We could employ this technique to prevent the formation of superficial abscesses, as long as they haven't already appeared; if so, it will be helpful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And some of them said that a bed should be placed above a window and then to draw out the air forcefully; this seems reasonable, but there is a fear that the window might suck up any superfluities through the weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And some suggested that the area should be covered with wool that has been soaked in warm oil, and powders should be placed between the ribs before filling it up, making sure the bandage is like a glove when wrapping around for roundness; then treat the patient carefully with dietary cures and medicine for pleurisy.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	If the patient is suffering from severe pain which they have not experienced before, and the bone punctures through the covering membrane, we fear for the patient's condition; thus, it is necessary to make an incision over that area, exposing the broken rib, and then place on top of it an instrument to keep the fracture in place, remembering to use the one previously mentioned, and to easily cut into the bone and remove the fragment.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	Then we must join the two edges of the wound together, if it is large, with sutures, and treat it with poultices until it is healed.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	If an abscess occurs internally, you should prepare and apply powders mixed with rose oil onto the area, and treat the patient with what is necessary to cure the abscess from within.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And make him lie down on his side, the one he usually sleeps on, until he recovers.

De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On restoring fractures of the vertebrae in the back and neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Some wounds present with fractures of the bones in the neck, and there is damage to their ligaments as well, similar to the vertebrae in the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And when this happens to someone and you want to know if they will recover or not, consider this: if their hands appear softened, numbed, paralyzed, and unable to move or make a fist, and when you pinch them with your fingers or prick them with a needle and they feel no pain, then you should know that they are not healed. In such cases, it is often fatal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	If they do feel the pressure of your fingers and the pricking, then you know that the neck bone is intact and the patient will recover.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see similar symptoms in the vertebrae of the neck and want to know their recovery prospects, consider their feet.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu. Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	But if none of these causes occur, then the cause is better and lighter.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	The treatment for him is to make an incision at the base of the abscess and place on the painful vertebra either some warmed oil or a lot of chicken broth. Apply this several times during the day until the abscess has been drained.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	Then apply one of the strengthening and stimulating plasters and cover it gently with a bandage, instructing the patient to rest and remain calm until they are healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if the necrosis of bone or any other cause that has already separated from him occurs, then you must cut away the damaged portion and remove this piece of bone. Then draw together the two edges of the wound with stitches if necessary. Finally, treat it with an ointment for wounds until it is healed.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	But if the posterior of the ischium bone has been fractured and it's at the end of the shaft, you must insert your left index finger into the anus to grasp the broken piece with your other hand as best you can; then place a plaster or splint over it if needed. Finally, bandage it securely.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquella, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De restauracio de la ancha.	On the restoration of the hernia.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the hernia are not usually broken, but if they break, the fracture is merely a communication between the ends of those bones and a sinking in of their extremities; there is also a deviation towards the parts within; this causes pain to the patient at that spot and a stiffness of the limb when it is fractured.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And for its restoration, you should place your hand on that part which is over the fracture in such a way as to imitate its shape.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if the fracture is only at its end, then you should align that part according to what appears appropriate by approximation and equality until it resembles its natural shape.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	But if the fracture is at its middle or there is already a deviation towards the parts within, then you should make the patient lie on their belly so that you can prepare for the restoration of that fracture.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And when you have aligned that part, place a plaster on it, then place over the plaster either a wooden splint or an iron one; bind this tightly so that you fear neither movement of the fracture nor displacement of the splint.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And fill the cavity with something that fills up the space where there is a constriction according to equality, and command the patient to sleep on his back or side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	If there is a sudden abscess, then cease the extension of it and its restoration until the abscess has been suppressed or reduced in size, and place on it whatever soothes as previously mentioned; thereafter return to restoring it, and bind it as tightly as required.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if it happens in the bones, whether they are shattered or broken, then you must treat them.
Capitol .xi.	In medieval medical texts, a "capitol" typically refers to a chapter or section of the treatise. So, this likely indicates that the text has reached Chapter 11 or Section 11.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the restoration of a fracture in the clavicle.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	Adjutori is what lies between the elbow and the top of the shoulder.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is broken, its restoration can be done in one of two ways. One way is to take a wooden splint of medium thickness and shape it like this:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And if both ends of the ligament are torn, it should be suspended from an elevated position.
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	Have the patient sit on a chair; then, extend their broken arm over a wooden splint so that its midpoint reaches the patient's wrist where there is a curve in the splint.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	Then place some heavy object over it, or else have the assistant stretch the arm at its extremities; meanwhile, let the doctor hold the fracture with both hands until the bone returns to its proper alignment.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	The other method is to have the patient lie on their back and suspend the hand of his neck with a ligament; then instruct two assistants to place themselves, one above the fracture holding it with both hands, while the other stands below; each should stretch at their end.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be stronger, then you pull on the fracture with a ligament and on that with another ligament, and each of the two ministers pulls at their respective ends.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And if the fracture is close to the end of the muscle, then half of the ligament should be placed on the wrist and the other below the fracture towards the elbow.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	Similarly, if the fracture is close to the elbow, then it should be placed on that spot and over that elbow.
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Secure that with ease and its work, then when it is secured according to what is required and applied with a good application, pull on that if no swelling occurs suddenly.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	But if swelling occurs suddenly, then leave the ligature in place for seven days, and put on it a moist woolen cloth soaked in vinegar and rose oil until the swelling subsides, then pull on that again.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	The way to pull on that is by putting a plaster over the fracture and then wrapping it with clean cloth; adjust the arm onto that support, and place their hand open over their muscle.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And place a cloth and bandage over the arm support so that the arm is held in place, unless there is some reason not to do this due to a broken bone.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And then use splints.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And make sure you place that splint over the fracture which is thicker and stronger than the other splints; leave a finger's width between each splint, and let their length be according to the break plus three fingers' breadth on either side.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then bandage over the splints with the binding method I described at the beginning of this chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And make sure your bandage over the fracture site is very tight.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And as the fracture gets longer, let your binding be looser.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And so if you see that the splints and binding are in place as we have described, at this point you will restore the limb to its proper position.
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear suppuration, then leave the bandage and splints in place for seven days as we have described.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	But if you are confident that nothing will happen, then do not remove the bandage for at least three days or more.
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And let the patient's sleep be on their back, with their hands placed over their stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	Place a clean, woolen pad on the assistant's arm, and make sure to check at all hours of the night or day that the shape of the broken limb remains undisturbed and the bandaging is not loosened; therefore, adjust it as needed with your skill.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	Feed the patient according to the order we mentioned before: let their food be light at first while they start recovering strength, and later make it more substantial.
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	By custom, the assistant and servant should stay close for forty days; afterwards, they can be released and the patient given a bath and treated with ointments to heal their ailment.
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	If the fracture is a badly-aligned one, then do not remove the bandage and splints for at least thirty days or up to two months.
Capitol .xii.	Certainly, let's continue translating this medieval medical treatise: 
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	De restauracio de fractura del bras.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	Bras is composed of two bones which are called the ulna and radius; where the first one is small, it is the bone under the index finger, and the other is big, it is the one that lies under the little finger, from the side below.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And it is likely that only the larger bone (the ulna) is broken, or just the smaller one (the radius), and it is also possible that they are broken together.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when the smaller bone (the radius) is broken above, its restoration is easier, and its healing is also lighter.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when the bone (the ulna) is broken below, its fracture is bad, and its healing is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And worse than that is when both bones are broken together.
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore, if the bone that is broken is the smaller one (the radius) above, it is beneficial for the doctor to make its restoration with a small extension, facilitating that it is splinted easily.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	But if it is the larger bone (the ulna) that is broken, then a stronger extension should be applied.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if both of the legs are trapped together, then it is necessary for you to place the pressure much harder.
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	And when you make the shape of the hand, it should be restored and extended over a cushion, with its wrist being at the level above everything mentioned before, while the little finger is lower than all other fingers mentioned previously,  and let the patient rest on their side using a comfortable pillow.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And there should be another cushion placed in front of them at the same height or a bit higher to prevent any strain on the patient.
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	Then the assistant extends their arm from below with their hand or wrist, while another assistant does it similarly from above.
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	Then the doctor aligns the bone until reducing it to its best possible shape.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if there is an injury on the bone surface, you must repair it by reducing all pieces back into their place with your strength.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	If there is a separated injury and you are not hopeful about the patient's recovery, then close it with stitches as described above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	But if the fracture is accompanied by an abscess, I have already dedicated a separate chapter to this, so now proceed to its treatment.
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	And if an abscess occurs during the beginning of your treatment process, you should apply a plaster made with rose oil and white wax, ensuring it is mild yet firm, and gently wrap it around the affected area until the abscess subsides. Then remove the plaster, apply an ointment prepared with chicken fat powder, and secure it in place; let this poultice be placed on both sides of the fracture firmly.
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	Keep in mind that the number of poultices applied to the arm depends on the severity and location of the fracture; it could be one if there's a single break or two if they are compound fractures.
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	Then apply your bandage firmly over the fracture site with extra force and vigor, ensuring that as you move away from the break towards both ends of it (above or below), the tightness of the bandage becomes slightly more gentle in comparison to how you started.
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	The cloths used to wrap around the fracture should be soft and moist, not rough or stiff, and the thread with which they are tied must strike a balance between fine and coarse, as we have previously advised.
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	And examine the limb and its ligament after a few days.
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	And if any cause occurs that requires correction, such as pain in the limb, then it is necessary to immerse the limb in warm water until the pain subsides.
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	Allow the limb to remain unrestrained so that it may rest, then return the bandage.
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	And if the bandage has already softened and the bone is nearly united and resembling its original state, then rectify everything with your skill.
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	Examine further if the nourishment is prevented from reaching the limb due to excessive bandaging, as in that case, you must loosen it slightly and leave it for a few days until nutrition reaches the affected area; then strengthen the bandage.
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	But if the patient does not experience any of the aforementioned causes, then there is no need to loosen the bandage for approximately twenty days.
E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	Then have the patient's hand suspended by their own strength of movement, and let them sleep on their back.
E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.	E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	Regarding the restoration of fractures in the fingers and hands:
Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	Know that in cases of fractures in the fingers or knuckles, one must proceed with caution and apply visible compresses of cloth.
E quan accideys a la ma fractura o atrissio, lahoras cove que·l malaute segua cayrat e denant lu lies cezent segon equalitat, e aprop pausa la ma de lu sobre aquela extenduda.	When treating a fracture or dislocation of the hand, it is necessary that the patient be laid down and covered with a warm blanket according to their comfort, then place their hand on an extended surface.
E aprop le ministre extenda les osses trencatz e·l metge engualhe aquels entro que sian congongitz am bona congoncio.	The assistant should extend the broken bones, and the doctor must realign them with care until they are properly aligned.
E lahoras cove que pause emplastre e estopa, si no accideys apostema caut; e aprop pausa stela desus segon la quantitat del loc, e tu ja has envolopada aquela en drap de li.	Then, one must apply a plaster and bandage it with cotton wool, unless an abscess forms in which case it should be drained; place a sterile cloth over the area according to its size, and wrap it with clean linen.
Mays si la trincadura es en las partidas dedintz deves le ventre de la palma, e lahoras fay semblant de spera de drap, e comanda al malaute que strenha aquela am la sua palma trincada; aprop sia strenguda am drap lonc.	However, if the fracture is in the joints inside the palm of the hand, make a small sphere with linen and instruct the patient to squeeze it tightly with their injured hand; then secure it with long strips of cloth.
E sia la stelha de cuer am drap en le qual sia levitat, per so que le cuer sia aplicat a la palma; e strenh aquela segon que cove.	And let there be a star-shaped piece of cloth that is raised and supported by the palm of your hand, in such a way as to apply pressure where needed.
Mays si la fractura es a las partidas defora, lahoras cove que pauses desus stela e autre estela de la partida dejos en la palma, per so que la ma sia uberta e dreyta; e aprop pausa la strictura, ayssi cum es revolvuda la ma a la rateta entre les ditz am liamentz.	If the fracture is at an outward angle, then place one star-shaped piece above and another below it on your palm, keeping your hand open and straight; then apply pressure as if you were turning your hand over with your fingers tied together.
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	And if there is a fracture at one of the knuckles of these fingers, and it's the thumb that is affected, then adjust it as needed and apply pressure with your palm; if you wish, place a small straight splint on it so that the fracture is elevated and not deformed.
Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	But if the fracture is in any of the other fingers, such as the one in the middle position, or the index finger, or the little finger, or the ring finger, then adjust it and bind it with the adjacent finger; or you can tie all of them together in a row, which is better; or place over it a small splint, as we said for the thumb.
E considera, en la tua restauracio, e aprop aquela, la disposicio de apostema caut e oppose — am la tieua operacio — am aquo que cove quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, segon que es iterada la narracio de lu.	And keep in mind, during your treatment and healing process, the development of an abscess. Be cautious and take appropriate action—through a small operation if necessary—to address any causes that may lead to such issues, as mentioned repeatedly in this narrative.

De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	When there is pain in the joints caused by excess humidity within the body, doctors call this podagra.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	The bone of the hip, which is clearly broken, will be declared so when it has been moved both forward and upward.
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	To restore the break, it is done this way: A strong bandage is placed over the fracture and another one under it; The patient lies on their stomach with their face down.
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	Then the minister extends the bandage to its limit according to its quality when the fracture is in the middle of the bone.
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	But if it is closer to the hip joint, then place the bandage below at the limit of extension, so that the extension stays in place, and the other bandage remains under the fracture.
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	Similarly, if the break is closer to the bottom, then place the bandage underneath and have its extension at the limits below.
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema. E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	Fill the spaces between the leg and calf with soft cloths, to promote clotting in the fracture.
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha. E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	Here is my translation of the given sentence:

Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	On the restoration of the fracture of the knee joint.
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	Know that the fracture of the knee joint often leads to stiffness; however, in many cases, it can also cause atrophy.
Mays si accideys a lu fractura, lahoras no es sino fissura o trauc en las suas partidas, e aquo es am plagua o ses plagua, e sobre aquo tot es estat am le sentiment. E la restauracio de lu es enayssi que sia engualat aquo que es romput de las partidas de lu am les ditz entro que sia agreguat e conjongit segon que es possible per equacio e facilitat e fabricacio.	And the restoration of the patient is done in this way: what has been broken or separated from their body parts should be replaced and joined together as much as possible through approximation, ease, and careful construction.

De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	Certainly! It seems we have now reached the title or heading of this particular chapter, which translates to "On the Restoration of a Leg Fracture."

E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una.	Here is my translation:
