De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	On the fracture of the talus and bones of the foot, as well as those mentioned above.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	The talus bone rarely experiences complete fractures; instead, some of the foot bones may fracture on occasion; and the toes of the foot are seldom fractured, only occasionally experiencing dislocations.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	And if the bones of the foot fracture and those bones become raised among themselves, then the patient should place their foot on prepared ground as they walk.
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	And then place one foot on what is elevated from those bones, and then press down on them, pushing and forcing them back into their places.
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	And then put an ointment and bandage over it, placing below the belly of the foot a small board with two flat ends.
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	Then stretch that foot with descending pressure because you have wrapped it in bandages and other necessary supplies.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And when three or four days have passed for him, then you can untie the bandages as you will find the bones pushed back into place, either fixed or displaced and so the operation on them is thus complete.
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	But if some say they are fixed, then restore those bones and push them back into place as I have also instructed you in the restoration of the bones of the hand.
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	Then place the fixed finger under the bar according to its length, and let it be slightly raised on either side of it; then put the foot on this board which was described to you earlier, stretching it with descending pressure.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	But if what is dislocated in the bones are two or three or more, then place on each finger a splint of its corresponding size wrapped in linen cloth, and fasten it to the base of the foot, and let them be held over one end of the board through the sole of the foot so that they have good retention.

De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	On the fracture of the pubic bone in women, as well as the ischium and coccyx bones in men.

Then the midwife should fill the pubic region with cotton, and it should be done in her so that it resembles a hope chest; afterwards, the woman should be shaken, and slowly lift her waist, as all of this is forgotten before she stands facing forward again, returning to how she was originally, with the dislocated bone back in place.

De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua."

Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura. E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And it should be round, with little thickness so that it does not bend, and ensure there is no compression on the wound during the operation.

E aquesta es la forma de lu:	This is how it should look:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And in Greek, it is called 'labra voluntas telarum', which means 'the small weaver's shovel'.

And when the bone is reduced but then the patient experiences severe pain again, know that the bone has not returned to its natural position; therefore, do this as it will greatly benefit the patient.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio. E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua. E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania. De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	On the treatment of swelling that occurs in the vicinity of any fracture." 
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Here is my translation:

De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	On the restoration of fractures, when it is restored but then this limb remains weak and feeble not according to its nature.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a bone fracture is restored, but the limb remains weak and feeble, this occurs for several reasons: one of which is the excessive discharge of its ligaments and their connection being lost as it should be; or due to excessive tightness in these ligaments preventing the nutrient from reaching the limb; or because of an excess of unnecessary ointment; or due to superfluous movement at the wrong time; or because of a lack of blood in the patient's body and their weakness.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	And the treatment for this is to feed the patient and make their heart tender until their blood has multiplied; administer baths; and instill joy and happiness upon them.

Then place clay on the affected limb, so that the clay draws out excess moisture and nutrients; or continue to anoint them with thick water until the nourishment flows back into its natural shape.

De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	Regarding the treatment of broken bones when they have been set incorrectly, prohibit any further operation or movement that could disturb their healing.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When the healed member begins to be affected by an incorrect setting and prominence of the broken bone, and as a result its shape is deformed, yet the member is not prevented from performing its natural functions, then it should not be considered newly broken.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	But there have been many ignorant doctors and healers who have done this in our land, and this operation is highly censured, leading to great fear as its signal is often fatal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt: If the disability and swelling are recent, then it is necessary to apply tepid water with softening herbs such as marshmallow leaves and roots, meadow lilies, and similar plants. Also, make an ointment for them using a softening ingredient like diellaquillon well made; or take a poultice of marshmallow root and bind it with goose grease or almond oil, then spread the poultice on the affected area; or prepare fatty figs by pounding them with dove feathers, as well as other similar substances from medicines called consolidation ammans.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And at times it is resolved through gentle but persistent friction using the moistest hands; and ensure that the affected member is moved frequently in all directions during all hours of the day.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	If the twisted condition has already progressed and become severe, turning into a stone-like substance that requires metal to treat it, then it is necessary to cease the practice above [likely referring to the twisting or manipulation of the affected area] and dissolve any subsequent bone deformities; carefully cut away unnecessary swelling around the bone using fine knives; and provide ease and careful consideration in this matter.
Capitol .xxiii.	Here is my best guess at translating these sentences: 
De sermo en dislocacio.	De sermo en dislocacio." 
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the displacement of any joint from its normal position, which restricts movement and results in an altered appearance of the limb, causing severe pain and injury to the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when dislocation occurs, you must act quickly to either perforate or reduce it, and do not delay in performing the reduction as this will lead to abscess formation at the joint, making the process of reducing the dislocation much more difficult.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And for this reason, the patient should not be massaged or stretched during the time of abscess formation as it often leads to muscle spasms and increased pain.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	But when this happens, you must perform flebotomy on the patient and then let the abscess drain naturally; after that, the limb should be treated with warm water and oil, which will make reducing the dislocation much easier.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And every limb should be treated with what will restore it to its original place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	I have already organized the chapters on dislocation according to what follows after fracture, starting from the uppermost part of the body and moving downwards.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Title: Chapter XXIV 
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	But when the dislocation is small, it often returns on its own with little effort.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	However, if the dislocation is complete and severe, it requires gentle reduction and should not be delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And let the minister hold the patient's head, and insert the doctor's finger(s) with their hand into the root of the dislocated jaw inside the patient's mouth if it is a one-sided dislocation; or insert both fingers if it is a two-sided dislocation, while the other hands of those assisting are outside matching theirs; then command the patient to close their jaws and bring them together again; as the doctor matches the jaw and pushes it back into place until it returns to its correct position.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	If the reduction is difficult, especially when both jaws are dislocated on either side, then administer vapour with warm water and oil until a gentle reduction of both can be achieved without delay in reducing them back to their correct positions as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And so when they have returned and are matched, but the patient's mouth remains closed and is not softened, then place over them cloths soaked in a powder made of wax and rose oil; and let it be done gently with soft bindings.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this should be administered with ease, and do not work on the perception of taste in their mouth when it comes to eating or drinking; rather occupy them with some task, while ensuring that their jaw is bound and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	If it is difficult to reduce the dislocated jaws back into their proper places, then this may lead to high fevers and persistent acidity, and often the patient's stomach becomes disturbed, and they frequently experience a bout of pure vomiting.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you observe this, understand that it leads to a point of no return; most often the patient will pass away due to these complications within ten days.

De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	This appears to be the title for chapter 25, which translates to: 
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	Furcula is not dislocated from the side within due to its continuity with the feet; and sometimes it is dislocated outwards at that point, and this is apparent to the touch.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And for restoration, the patient should be placed on their back and extend their arms.

The extremity of the one who cuts the bone and it is continuous with that (bone), is not dislocated on any day; so it must be reduced and fastened as we have said and according to what is available in your equipment.

And then place an ointment and powder dressing over it, apply a bandage tightly, and instruct the patient to adhere to tranquility and rest until they are healed.

De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle." translates to "On the reduction of a muscle dislocation.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partita dejos." translates to "Know that the muscle is not dislocated in only three ways, one of which is when it is dislocated from the root down.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis." translates to "And the second way is when it is dislocated above the muscle, which happens rarely. It cannot be dislocated behind through the shoulder, nor in front by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat." translates to "It is usually dislocated and exits below the root, especially in those places where there is little flesh, it is lightly dislocated. But in areas with more flesh, it comes out with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat." translates to "And very rarely does it happen that a man receives a blow or fall and his muscle becomes inflamed with an enclosed inflammation, and is thus fixed because it was already dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	When the dislocation of [the patient] is at the points below the ears; so that you can distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the healthy one, since there will be clear differences between them; and you find on the head of the muscle a concavity below the ear; touching the head of the muscle, it's like an egg, and to the patient is impossible move his hand to his ear or reach it with any movement.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If the foot or ankle is dislocated, and you find a clear bump there that cannot be hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	In this case, when the patient is young and [the injury] is recent there's an easy reduction of the dislocation.  *Note: 'le' means 'the' in the original text.*
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	The reduction [of the injury] is when an attendant lifts the patient's arm above their head and places his arms under the ear of the patient, then raises the joint with strength to its place; as the attendant lifts the hand of the patient, he stretches it upwards and gently lays it back down.  *Note: 'dejos' means 'under'.*
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if after all that we have said it doesn't return to its place and [the injury] is recent then it's necessary for the patient to take a bath in warm water and be given an infusion that softens and calms like grated turnip roots of Althaea, fenugreek, honey locust in water, and be administered. *Note: 'mays' means 'but'.*
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is weak, then let something else be suspended on them to weigh them down, because the dislocation can return quickly.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced in another way as well: let a long piece of wood be placed on the ground with its head rounded like a mortar pestle that isn't too thick or thin and then place the patient underneath; since cloths have been placed over the top of the wooden pole, and the patient stands according to the length of the wood, then extend their arm to one side while their body is extended in the other direction with force because the joint will quickly return to its proper position.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if it is difficult to reduce the patient due to all the reasons we've mentioned, then use this treatment method: take a wooden pole that is two yards in length and four fingers in width, and its thickness should be as wide as your index finger like so...
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	Then at the rounded end, secure it with some linen cloth to ensure that the pole doesn't injure the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And place it beneath the patient's armpit, and have them stretch out their arm or hand over the pole towards the other end, then tie the wooden pole to their helper's forearm as well as the patient's own arm and hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Now place the arm on a step of the ladder according to its latitude, and let the hand be extended downwards, while the other body is suspended from the opposite side, for the joint will enter promptly.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when you have completed the insertion of it in every way that is possible to you, then you must place a tickling stick above the affected area with as much woolen material as seems appropriate; and then place a plaster prepared from powder of moly with oil of lilies over all the muscle, so that it may be stirred up, and then press the tickler down with decent tension; and let the bandage be wound around the plaster, and his hand attached to his neck, and let him be left in this position for seven days without moving his hand.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And let the diet of the patient be light, while the member is being strengthened, as it is easier for recovery.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then give him a heavier diet after seven or five days of exercise; and if he remains firm without softening, then he is already cured.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	If the joint has been dislocated several times due to humidity or another cause, then it is necessary that a three-pronged cautery be applied there, as previously mentioned in the chapter on cauterization.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	From the dislocation of the one made between the foot and hip or its parts behind it, reduction is done with impulse and extension using hands until return.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And in the other, administer tightness and cure it until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if the healing process is affected by the weight of the body part and delays its mobility, then the patient should use warm baths until that heaviness is alleviated and it returns to its former nature.

De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	Regarding the treatment of shoulder dislocation." 
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle. E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	If the dislocation is in the front parts of the body, then return it by bending the arm towards their hand, while striking the elbow with the edge of their palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not respond to reduction attempts, then administer strong and forceful extension with vigor.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	Have two assistants extend the arm while two other assistants hold it in place to prevent any movement during the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	Then rotate the arm in all directions while it is wrapped with a folded cloth or bandage around their hand and secured tightly.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	When the doctor touches the joint with their hand, they should grease it with some oil to facilitate lubrication of the joint and ease movement. Then push on the joint forcefully while returning it to its place.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	After the reduction is complete, place a plaster on it that contains a mixture of styptic and egg white, and apply it with a gentle binding. Suspend the arm from the neck and leave it like this for a few days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	Then it is unbound; if the joint has healed in its place, you can release the bandage and leave it.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	Here is the translation of the sentence you provided: 
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt. E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	Sure, here is the translation of the provided text:
am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.

And if you wish, place on that moist and scraped cowhide some border strips with edges trimmed over it; do this several times, for the hide is moist and will return to its original condition.

De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	On the treatment of dislocation of the shoulder joint, which is located between the arm and hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	Sometimes the dislocation of the hand is slight, and its reduction can be easily managed, but it is different with other joints; however, speed in the process of reducing such a dislocation at the moment when it occurs is essential before any swelling appears or becomes infected.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the method of reducing this dislocation is for you to place the patient's hand joint on a table and have your assistant extend their arm; then the doctor places his or her palm over the prominence of the joint, pushing it until it returns to its normal position.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However, one must consider whether the palm is already facing towards the abdomen of the hand; in that case, have the patient place the back of their hand on a table with the arm extended and reduced; if the dislocation occurs at the back of the hand, then the position of the hand should be intrinsically on the table so that the doctor's hand can press down upon the prominence of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	However, the joint remains in its twisted position; and you do not find any cause for this in the patient, except that their hand is softened and cannot make a fist; then know that their nerves are constricted or torn, and there is no remedy but to strengthen it with cautery near the joint, and give them something warm to drink.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	When the swelling is reduced, apply on them the plaster we have prepared, and let it be left and bound for five days; then it should be unbound and again left, and their hand should be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if their movement is impeded and some severity occurs in them, then ease that with warm water and gentle friction several times until it is alleviated.
Capitol .xxix.	It seems this indicates the end of chapter 29 or section 29 in the treatise. Is there another passage you would like me to translate?
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the treatment of dislocation of the aforementioned." 
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	E quan es dislocat algún dit de aquells al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahors tens le dit e impellys la disllocació de lu amb les teues mans, fins que torne a la seua posició.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the head of the finger, and suspend that part which is dislocated above it, and leave it like this for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	Then suspend that [body part] and stretch it until it is properly aligned on its own level, leaving it like this for a day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it is night, bind that [body part] according to the narrative, and do not cease to loosen it during the day and exercise with movements, binding it at night; do this for several days until it becomes tight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	Do likewise if it is the wrist of the hand that is dislocated; bind it to that area and do this first operation until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	Similarly, do the same when other parts of the body are dislocated.
Capitol .xxx.	It seems you have provided me with a chapter number; please give me more context so I may assist you better.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Chapter 30: On the treatment of dislocation of the spine vertebrae.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When any of the vertebrae in the spine or neck become completely dislocated and the spinal cord is pinched due to these bones moving from their places, there is usually little hope for treatment as death quickly follows for the patient. 
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Donc aquella ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	However, the cure for this is that you should consider whether the disease occurs in childhood, as then there is neither a cure nor complete recovery.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But for those illnesses which occur due to a fall, or a blow, or something similar, the Ancients have already described methods of cure in lengthy treatises, from which the main principles return to their original source; but I have shortened that, out of which the little avoids the excess of it, because of my own proximity to my own intention and exposition, with which I have presented this and developed those things.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in the disease which occurs at the front of the foot, there is neither treatment nor cure for it; similarly in those diseases which are caused on both sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And there is cure only for those diseases which occur on the back itself, with what I have recounted.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And if the patient is placed on their face close to a wall, and something moist is placed under them so that their feet are not stretched.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	Then a straight stick is placed, fixed in the ground at the head end near his head, and another stick around his feet at the other end of the bench.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	The minister holds the trunk, do not stay in one place and another minister holds it from the other side following this procedure.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	Then cover the patient's head and tie it lightly with a bandage so that their eyes are closed; extend the end of the bandage to the trunk, which should be placed behind their head, and secure it there; then tighten another bandage over their hips at their rear, extending down towards their legs; finally, adjust all the bindings and tie them on the other pole located near their feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	Then each minister extends the bandage to its respective pole and they should not be dislocated from their positions or from the poles' locations where they are attached, but again, they must not remain in one place as we have mentioned earlier.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	The doctor places his palms on the patient's spine with strength until it returns to its place or he puts him on a table and adjusts their legs onto that same table.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if it does not return to its place by this method, then take a table whose length or width is approximately three feet in circumference and carve out a space on the wall where we previously mentioned that the patient was located so that one end of the table can be inserted inside said hole.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then place half of the table on the spine, with the doctor placing their feet on the other end. Then push firmly so that the vertebra is realigned and returns to its proper position.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	If you wish, open the wooden peg that has been turned by hand; and when you lay him on the ground, place one of his arms behind a post that is as long as an arm's length; likewise, place another post behind the patient's head with the same length; there should be a palm-length distance between each post, and in both posts drill a hole for the wooden peg to pass through; then firmly secure each post into the ground so it cannot move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	Place a round wooden shaft into the hole which contains the peg; turn this shaft so it moves within the holes of both posts.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	There should be a hole at the end of this shaft which is one palm-length from where it turns; there should also be similar holes drilled into both posts.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	Then tighten the straps you have placed around his legs near where his head is positioned; as well as those that secure his thighs in place by the wooden shaft near his feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then you must have each person turn and lie down while a minister turns the handle with their hand, and the doctor aligns the spine as we mentioned earlier.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	This is how the device looks like:" (Here you can insert an image or description of the medical instrument being described.)
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	Now that the spine has been realigned and the area is adjusted, you should apply an exciccatio (a type of medicated paste) with egg white as a base, then pack it with cotton; next place on top of the paste a wooden splint whose width is about three fingers or so, and its length should match the size of the affected area, extending over the spine.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	Then bind it with the ligament as mentioned earlier, and feed the patient a diet of subtle nourishment until they recover.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	If there is any remaining bulge in the area after treatment, it is necessary to administer medicines that soften and ease with long-term application of a plaster as recommended earlier; a lead plate has already been placed in that location.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	Sometimes bulging occurs in the lower spine at the back and it is dislocated there; this bone should not be exposed to any pressure from said medicine as its strength might cause death.
Capitol .xxxi.	Capitol .xxxi.: Chapter 31.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	For the treatment of a dislocated hip." 
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Here is my translation of the provided source sentence: 
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And it is mostly dislocated inwards, and rarely outwards or backwards.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	The sign of the dislocation towards the inside is that when you align the patient's affected leg with the healthy one, it appears longer and the ankle is more prominent compared to the healthy side. The patient cannot bend their foot inward; this is the area where a closed abscess forms on the back of the ankle because the head of the talus has reached this point.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The sign of the one who has experienced a dislocation outwards is that their symptoms are opposite to the previous case.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	The sign of the one who has a dislocation forward is when they extend their leg as much as possible, but cannot bend it at the ankle due to pain there; if they attempt to walk, they are unable to step forward. Their urine flow is obstructed and the back of their heel becomes abscessed, forcing them to walk on their tiptoes.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	The sign of the one who has a dislocation backward is that they cannot extend their ankle nor bend it forward without pain at the heel; their affected leg appears shorter than the other, and the back of their heel softens. The head of the talus bone is now located there.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	When the dislocation is recent and it falls into one of four types of dislocations, then you must apply this treatment: return the joint to its place by stretching it in all directions, both inward and outward, as well as on the right and left sides, because often it returns easily and needs no further treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return in this way, then you must prepare a strong and thick cloth, extending the patient's leg from below with their hands or tied to something above; another servant will extend the patient's hand from above so that they can put their hands under the armpits; then bind tightly with bandages around the hips, while another servant holds the end of the bandage.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And the patient's extension or inner part is made painful at the fork joint or at the back toward the spine.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And the extension of all those parts is done at once while the patient is raised with their body off the ground and hanging.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	This type of extension is common to all four types of dislocation.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	Then another strong minister takes hold of his arms, and firmly grasps the swollen area around the patient's groin, pulling it outwards with a vigorous movement, for this allows it to return to its proper place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	This procedure is the lightest cure among the others, as this member is reduced without any other special treatment.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if you are unable to assist and do not comply with this type of treatment, then it is necessary to tie both the patient's feet together strongly, lightly, above both heels and all toes.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And let the length of each strap be equal to four fingers, and let the diseased leg be extended more than the other by two finger-widths.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	Then let the patient be suspended above the head of the bedstead, and that he be in the middle; let his height from the ground be equal to two arms' lengths.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	Then command a strong youth to pull the head of the groin upwards, and let another young man be suspended with the patient, while the other youth pulls on the leg with strength, for the joint will return to its place swiftly.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And then each minister extends to his side, and the doctor with his hand performs the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if you obey the reverse, sir, it will be greatly beneficial; and if not, place pressure on that area diligently, and thus we have said to treat it with caution in case of rupture.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	Make sure the patient lies on their side comfortably.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in the front part of the body, it is necessary to slightly extend the leg, and this action must be performed according to the description above; then the doctor places their right palm on the affected joint, and with the other hand they grip that area while extending the leg downwards.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	If the dislocation is in the rear part of the body, it should not be extended downwards but elevated from the ground; instead, they must lie on a hard surface just as required for their arm if it is dislocated outwards, according to what we have said about placing them on two pillows. They will lie on their front and their limbs must be extended accordingly.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And make sure that compression is applied using a board over the area where the joint is located.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	So, once the reduction is completed as required - and you see an indication of successful reduction in that you have spread the patient's legs apart, and when you observe these movements and the patient draws their leg back in without any explanation, then you know that the limb has been properly returned to its correct position - adjust two cushions and place some poultice, and remove it with a bandage so that there is no pressure on any part; keep the patient at rest for three or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	Then untie the bandage and poultice, and compare one leg to the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	If you see these same movements upon examination, then you know that the dislocation is healed, and so allow the patient to get up.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any sign of softening, then you must return and plaster the area again, remove it according to your initial instructions, and keep them at rest for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	Then untie it, and have them delay walking for a few days until they are comfortable.
Capitol .xxxii.	Sure! Here is my translation of your text line by line into English: 
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The kneecap is dislocated in three ways: it can be dislocated outwards, inwards, or downwards towards the back; but it cannot be dislocated forwards.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	The sign of dislocation is when you instruct the patient to bring their leg towards their thigh, and then you can determine that the kneecap is indeed dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	To restore the kneecap in all three ways, you should make the patient stand straight and extend their leg if possible; attach your hands to their face and place their foot between your feet; then take hold of their kneecap with your palms, gripping it firmly between your thumbs on top of their kneecap while another assistant extends their leg so that the kneecap returns to its original position.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	The sign of successful restoration is when the patient's leg adheres to their thigh with effortless movement.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then plaster that area and make sure the leg is attached to the thigh; bind those parts together with a bandage for three or four days; then remove the bandage.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not allow the patient to walk for a few days until they are healed and strengthened.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if the reduction of it to you is excused, then provide strong extension with the same bandages as used in the hip cure mentioned earlier.
Capitol .xxxiii.	This indicates that this information is from chapter 33 of a book or treatise. It seems to be a chapter marker or heading, providing context for the following medical instructions or discussions.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the treatment of dislocation of the ankle." 
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation is when you see the ankle swelling, proceeding from the part that has been dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	May the cure for removal be a gentle reduction, and it should be done with ease using your hands, ensuring that it is smoothed out as it returns to its place.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	When treating a patient with a severe dislocation, it is necessary to make the patient lie down straight, and have a strong and valiant assistant stand behind their back in the middle of their body.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	Then you place your right hand on the upper part of the foot and your left hand below it at the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And you pull the foot towards your right hand and then with both hands for two times, after which you extend it using your left hand while keeping the patient's toes on the floor below their shin.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	Do this two times as we have counted before.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	Then place the foot's toes on the shin for the third time and make sure your hand is at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Therefore, if you return the foot once or twice in this manner and see that it is loosened, it is good. If not, then repeat the operation again, for it returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if you are prohibited from reducing it as we have described above, then make the patient lie on their back on the ground, and tightly place a small board under them between their thighs, and wrap them with cloth so that the patient does not feel cold.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	Then have the patient's assistant hold their legs, and another minister extend the foot with their hands or with a cloth tied over the ankle; then each assistant stretches against the extension of their part, and let the board be extended between the patient's thighs to prevent their body from being pulled towards the parts below due to its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	Then the doctor loosens the dislocation with their hands, and another assistant holds the healthy leg below it, for the dislocation returns easily.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And so, when the dislocation returns and you are certain of the healthiness of the reduction, then place a plaster cast on it and tightly bind it with bandages, tying the foot to the leg.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And be careful or mindful of the nerves that are located at the back of the ankle, to ensure that the binding or wrapping around it is not too tight and does not harm or damage those nerves.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	Then leave it like that for two days or three; if the binding has softened, remove it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	Then loosen or untie the binding on either the third day or fourth; forbid the patient from walking for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	However, if the patient is forced to walk before this period of time has passed, it should be assumed that the dislocation has not been fully corrected or properly healed; and thus, it will likely not respond well to treatment.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if the patient develops an acute abscess or infection, then you should apply the same treatment and ointment described earlier to other affected areas of the body until it is resolved.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	It seems that this indicates the end of section thirty-four in the treatise, marking a new chapter or topic to be discussed next. It follows a conventional format for organizing such texts into numbered sections or chapters.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the treatment of dislocations of the aforementioned toes." 
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	If the dislocation is in any of the joints of the foot, then it's necessary to make the patient put their foot on the floor or on a table, and they should remain like that as if they were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	Then stand by the patient's side and place your foot on what is above the joints, then press that with your foot with strength until it returns to its original position, and make sure there are no bumps or lumps remaining.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	Place a board under the patient's foot that covers it completely, this board should have two ends. Then strap that with a bandage that is tight and secure for three days; after you untie them, make sure they rest from walking for many days until their recovery is guaranteed.

De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	On the types of dislocations caused by a blow, fracture or any other kind of accident.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of these cases happen, and you undertake the treatment and restoration process, it's likely that death will occur many times.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	Certainly, I can continue translating the provided text: 
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And now, exert yourself immediately to perform on him the reduction at the beginning of the treatment, before it becomes a dangerous abscess.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And if the limb returns to its desired position, administer a treatment that prevents dangerous abscesses and cures the wound with whatever dried ointments are suitable for him.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	If the dislocation is accompanied by a fracture and the bones are separated at their joints, then you pierce the membrane between them, and do as we have previously mentioned for simple illnesses that affect these areas.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	Be mindful and avoid any instruments that cause fear according to the teachings I have given you previously; for this is better for your true self, more permanent for your glory, and more beneficial for your soul in the long run.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the words of Albucasis, may God bless us all.
